title: Auliyanakhana
content: Auliyanakhana river starts from the lowland of Jaldhaka upazila and ends at the Ghaghat river. It covers Jaldhaka upazila, Nilfamari and Kishorganj upazila. The total length of the river is 28 km.

title: Akhira
content: Akhira river starts from the Chouddabuban bil of Rangpur district and ends at the Kartoya-Bangali river. It covers Pirganj, Palashbari, Ghuraghat. The total length of the river is 90 km.

title: Agarpur
content: Agarpur river starts from the Palardi river of Barisal district and ends at the Shikarpur river. It covers Muladi upazila-Gauranadi upazila-Babuganj upazila,Barisal.

title: Agunmukha
content: Agunmukha river starts from the Tentulia river of Barisal district and ends at the Kalmi khal. It covers Galachipa upazila. Wave of this river in the estuary of Sea looks like fire flame, that’s why it’s called Agunmukha.

title: Arpangachiya
content: Arpangachiya river starts from the Sundarban near Satkhira district and ends at the Patni island near bay of Bengal. It covers Sundarban.

title: Atharobanki
content: Atharobanki river starts from the Madhumati river and ends at the Bhairab river. It covers South of the Khulna district. The total length of the river is 40 km.

title: Atra
content: Atra river starts from Bagharpara upazila and ends at the Bhairab river. It covers Bagharpara upazila, Narail sadar upazila. The total length of the river is 23 km.

title: Atrai
content:
Atrai river locally known as Gubura (west side), Kronka (east side). It starts from the Karatoya river and ends at the Hurasagar river. It covers Jayganj-Birganj-kotwali,Dinajpur; Noagaon; Natore; Pabna
The total length of the river is 385 km. It’s a transboundary river

title: Andhar Manik
content: Adhar Manik river starts from the Tiyakhali river and ends at the bay of Bengal near Kolapara upazila. It covers Patuakhali district

title: Afra
content: Afra river starts from the Chitra river and ends at the Bhairab river. It covers Baghmara upazila, Narail sadar. The total length of the river is 30 km.

title: Abua
content: Abua river locally known as Nandia gang. It starts from the Jadukata-Rakti river and ends at the Baulai river. It covers Bishambarpur-Jamalganj,Sunamganj. The total length of the river is 20 km.

title: Amandaman
content: Amandaman river starts from the Belhara bil and ends at the Nagar river. It covers Baliadangi upazila,Thakurgaon. The total length of the river is 11 km.

title: Alaikumari
content: Alaikumari river locally known as Alaikuri river. It Starts from the lowland of Rangpur sadar, Pirgacha upazila and ends at the Ghaghat river. It covers Rangpur sadar, Pirgacha upazila. The total length of the river is 33 km.

title: Arpangashia
content: Arpangashia river starts from the Khulpetuya, Kopotakhya river and ends at the Malanch river. It covers Sundarban

title: Arial Khan
content: Arial khan river starts from the Padma river and ends at the Tentulia channel. It covers Faridpur; Madaripur; Gouranadi upazila,Barisal. The total length of the river is 263 km. Famous for its history and religious beliefs

title: Arial Khan
content: Arial khan river starts from the Old Brahmaputra river and ends at the Meghna river. It covers Manuhardi, Belabo, Raypura, Shibpur, Narshingdi town.

title: Alongjani
content: Alongjani river starts from the Jamuna river and ends at the Dhaleshwari river; then again starts from the Dhaleshwari river and ends at the Nangli river. It covers Manikganj, Tangail districts. The total length of the river is 35 km.

title: Atrai
content:
Atrai river locally known as Gubura (west side), Kronka (east side). It starts from the Karatoya river and ends at the Hurasagar river. It covers Jayganj-Birganj-kotwali,Dinajpur; Noagaon; Natore; Pabna
The total length of the river is 385 km. It’s a transboundary river

title: Atai
content: Atai river starts from Baradiya and ends at the Bhairab river. It covers Narail, Khulna. The main stream of this river is known as Majutkhali.

title: Atrai Upper
content: Atrai upper river starts from Dhamurhat upazila and ends at the Atrai river. It covers Noagaon district. It’s a transboundary river

title: Atrai Lower
content: Atrai lower river starts from the Atrai upper river and ends at the Hurasagar river. It covers Dhamurhat, Patnitala, Mahadebpur, Manda, Bagmara, Atrai, Singra, Gurudaspur, Chatmahar, Bhangura, Shahjadpur.

title: Alam
content: Alam river starts from the Alamjani river and ends at the Chauhat jhil. It was originated 125 years ago.

title: Alai
content: Alai river locally known as Mora Ghaghat river. It starts from the old stream of Ghaghat river and ends at the Karatoya river. It covers Gaibandha district.

title: Arashibsa
content: Arashibsa river starts from the Shibsa river and ends at the Shakbaria river. It covers Khulna district

title: Ayla
content: Ayla river starts from Chadkhali and ends at the Beghai river. It covers Patuakhali district. It’s a historical river of Muslim ruling.

title: Am
content: Am gang starts from Parkul and ends at the Surma river.

title: Aroya
content: Aroya gang starts from Bhaludeon and ends at the Kolkoliya gang.

title: Ariya
content: Ariya river starts from the Kangsa river and ends at the Khariya khal.

title: Akhila
content: Akhila river starts from the Sonabari bil and ends at the Khiro river.

title: Amori
content: Amori khal starts from Harpunji and ends at the Lova river.

title: Alika
content: Alika river starts from the balishira hill and ends at the Runiya bil.

title: Akali
content: Akali gang starts from the Haoya bil & Bhubhanga bil and ends at Daspara.

title: Azimpur River
content: This river has been originated from the boundary line of Hijli and Mehendiganj upazila of BBarisal and flows toward Meghna river at southern part of Hijli.

title: Agarpur River
content: It emerges from Palardi river at the boundary line of Gauronodi and Muladi upazila of Barisal district and ends at the boundary of Babuganj.

title: Akti River
content: It started from Narayanganj which is situated at the borders of Tahirpur and Sunamganj and ended in Nondiya/Baga gang after crossing Baghmara, Angaruli, Sonarhaor and Chandbari.

title: Aroa Gang
content: It started flowing from several streams of Beribeel and Jahidpur of Nabiganj Upazilla, Habiganj and fall in Bijna Gang at Debpara.

title: Akhila River
content: It started flowing from Deorai River at Fulbaria Upazilla and fall into Radha Beel joining with Nageshwar River.

title: Aida Gang
content: It started flowing from Sidkhai of Dirai Upazilla of Sunamganj and fall into kewalakhai Beel.

title: Alkashni River
content: This river ousted from Akhapur of Bochaganj Upazilla, Dinajpu that flows up to Sripur and Vitman Dangi.

title: Bural River
content: Ousted from Doulotonurpur (between Mithapukur and Rangpur Sadar Upazilla) that advanced to Biratihat.

title: Butidona River
content: Ousted from South edge of Shyampur (Madardah hat, Rangpur) that discharged into Atrar Beel at Fatehopur.

title: Bachai
content: Bachai gang starts from Kandigaon and ends at the Singhar khal.

title: Bakhala
content: Bakhala river starts from the Ubdakhali river and ends at Nazirpur.

title: Bagaja
content: Bagaja river starts from the Khasura river and ends at the Boundary of Alampur.

title: Betari
content: Betari river starts from the Kushiyara river and first stream ends at the Chatal bil, second stream ends at the Noluya bil & Masuya bil, third stream ends at the Kushiyara river, again fourth stream ends at the Kushiyara river.

title: Burijuri
content: Burijuri gang starts from the Baulta bil and ends at the Chatal bil.

title: Banga
content: Banga jhora starts from Janekona and ends at the Chinakur bil.

title: Barsia River
content: This river has been emerged at Mohammadpur upazila, Jessore District and ends at Fatiya of Faridpur district.

title: Bishnu River
content: The river that takes off from Kumarkhali river at Rampal Upazila and ends by meeting with Daudkhali river at Mohishkhali is known as Bishnu river.

title: Bishkandia River
content: It tekes off at Kalkini upazila and Madaripur Sadar upazila boundary and ends by meeting with Kumar river at Kamarbari.

title: Binodpur River
content: It emerges at the boundary line of Shariatpur and madaripur district and ends  at Domsar.

title: Bamonkhali River
content: It emerges from Narail Sadar upazila and Shalikha that ends by meeting with Naboganga river.

title: Bangra River
content: It originates from Poshur riber at Sharonkhola pazila of Bagerhat district and then ends by falling into Bay of Bengal.

title: Bashbaria River
content: It originates at Amtoli upazila and ends  at the edge poind of Ichadi char region.

title: Bagura River
content: Gopinathpur and Malidanga upazila is the source area of this river and ends at Kakramoni with Ichamoti river.

title: Betmara River
content: Greater Pangsha is the source area of this river and at Shatkhira ends by meeting with Malancha river.

title: Bogi River
content: This river takes off from Bhola river at Shoronkhola upazila of Bagerhat district then falls into Boleshor river.

title: Barisal River
content: The nortern Bakerganj is the origin region of this river and flows through this district before falling into Arial Khan river.

title: Bukhainagar River
content: Barisal Sadar Upazila is the source region of this river. It ends its flowing at Char Gopalpur by meeting with Arial Khan.

title: Baiguru River
content: It takes off from Babuganj Upazila and ends by meeting with Arial Khan river.

title: Bura Gaurango River
content: It originates from Sabajpur Chanel at Lalmohon  upazila and flows upto Char Kukri-mukri.

title: Baurer River
content: Betna river at Shatkira district is the source region of this river that ends by meeting with kopotakkho river at Horohor upazila.

title: Bashdoho River
content: Chaltitola upazila of Shatkhira district is the emerged region of this small river. Then it meets with Morischap river at Kamalkati.

title: Baokhola River
content: The kula upazila of Shatkhira district is the origin space for this river from Karuli river and ends by meeting with Minaj river at Haranbari.

title: Botlua River
content: The Arr Pangia Reserve Forest of Sundarban is the origin place of this river at Shatkhira district and then ends by meeting with Boll river.

title: Bugli Doon River
content: Through Thakurpara and Paler Boltoli of Borguna district, it stars to flow and ends by meeting with Andharmanik river.

title: Bhaimara River
content: It originates from Gangni upazila that has two flows. One of them falls at daliarpur and another at Pulbila with Mathavanga river.

title: Bhatu River
content: The Sadar upazila of Chuadanga District is the source region of this river that ends by meeting with Tior low land.

title: Bogkhali River
content: It is small river that originate from high Land of Parbotto Chittagong that flows west to meet with Bay of Bengal. Length is 53 km. It influences by ebb and tide and navigable whole year.

title: Bogi River
content:
This river originated from Vola river at Sarankhola Upazilla, Bagerhat that fall into Boleshwar river.
Length of this river is 3 km. width is 150 meters. Depth is 12 meters. Basin size is 12 sq. km.
This is seasonal river with continue flow. On the right bank of this river Sundarban is situated.

title: Bangshi River
content:
This river generated from Modhumoti river at Modhupur Gor, Tangail that falls into Dhaleshwar river near Savar. It travels through Modhupur, Ghatail, kalihati, Basail of Tangail District, Kaliakor of gazipur and Savar Upazilla of Dhaka.
Length of this river is 184 km. Width is 70 meters. Depth is 8 meters. Catchment size is 1077 sq. km.

title: Barar
content: Barar river starts from Raghunathpur & Boro Pathaliya and one stream ends at Singua, another stream ends at the North of Rashidpur.

title: Barira
content: Barira river starts from Khagdahar and ends at the boundary of Trishal.

title: Bilash
content: Bilash river starts from the Balishira hills and ends at Srimangal. Another course of it starts from Dhalai tea garden and ends at Shitbari.

title: Baghachara
content: Baghachara starts from the Kathalkandi hill and ends at the Dhalai river.

title: Bar
content: Bar river starts from the Hair river and ends at the Bital river.

title: Bagala
content: Bagali river starts from Patali and ends at the Mahasingha river.

title: Beri
content: Beri gang starts from the Ghuraura river and first stream ends at the Ghuraura river, second stream ends at the Dawdanga river, third stream ends at the Kurikhah gang, forth stream ends at the Suti river.

title: Bakhrabad
content: Bakhrabad nala starts from the Katlar char and ends at the Meghna river.

title: Bat
content: Bat river starts from Madhunagar & Dapatuli bil and ends at the Singua river.

title: Bodiya
content: Bodiya river starts from Tukarkandi, Chiknakandi & Shitarampur and ends at the Kalni river.

title: Bhogra
content: Bhogra river starts from Fatehpur and ends at Habibur.

title: Bajja
content: Bajja river starts from the Borobil and first stream ends at the Borobil, second stream ends at the Ratai bil, third stream ends at the Ratkuri bil.

title: Bannari
content: Bannari river starts from the Dhanu river and ends at Arliya.

title: Bhutikhali
content: Bhutikhali river starts from Kakbabad & Dawdhara and ends at the Bhugai river.

title: Bishmai
content: Bishmai river starts from Kaksiriya-Maskandar and ends at the West of Hariyatola.

title: Baliya
content: Baliya river starts from the Bahuli river and ends at the Urshabil.

title: Bilash Chara
content: Bilash chara starts from Humnabad tea garden and ends at the Lengura haor. It’s second course starts from Korotola, third stream ends at the Hail haor.

title: Bahiya
content: Bahiya gang starts from Chadir Kapan and ends at the Surma river.

title: Bishkhali(bagerhat) River
content: It originate from ‘bolessor’ which is not far from kachua-morelganj border.It flows inside the morelganj upazilla  and then it merged with ‘panguchi’ river which flows  in the opposite of morelganj upazilla.The total length of this river is 96 km.

title: Buragourango river(বুড়া গৌরাঙ্গ নদী )
content: It originates from the north side of vola upazilla called ‘meghna’.It is running  over the  south part of vola upazilla of lalmohon and corfashion area.The total length of the river is 90 km.

title: Bura-matamuhuri river(বুড়া মাতামুহুরী নদী)
content: It expresses itself from the chakaria upazilla,coxsbazar zilla and fall into maheskhali channel .It covered the area of chakaria upazilla.The length of the river is 35 km.

title: Buri river(বুড়ি নদী)
content: It originates from the Salda river, situated in Kosba upazila, nabinagar, Siddhirganj, Kaliganj etc are situated in the bank of this river.The length of the river is 20 km.

title: BuriKora-chiki river(বুড়িখুড়া-চিকি নদী)
content: It originates from the swamp area  of demra upazilla and merged with  the river of ‘deonai charalkatha’ which is just beside from the badarganj rail-station.The length of the river is 48 km.

title: Barnai river
content: It originates from the ‘tanor bil’ and fall at boral river near of ‘arani bil’.It started to running over south from ‘tanor bil’firstly then started to flow north-east.T40k.m he length of the river is 40 km.

title: Barinda River(বারিন্দা নদী)
content: It express itself from the low area of mohera union,mirzapur upazilla and merged with the futjani river ,vatgram union.Then it entered kaliakoir upazilla and flow beside the oarsi,bahuria,rajabari union.It merged bongshi river of the border arear of damrai and savar upazilla.

title: Balu river(বালু নদী)
content: It started to flow from ‘tongi khal’ of tongi upazilaa,gazipur zilla and fall  at shitalakshya river.The length of the river is 45 km. runs mainly through the extensive swamps of Beel Belai and those east of Dhaka, joining the shitalakshya near demra. It has a narrow connection through the Suti Nadi near kapasia with the Shitalakshya, and also by way of the Tongi Khal with the turag; there is also a link with the Shitalakshya near kaliganj.

title: Bashr river(বাশর নদী)
content: It originates from tangail zilla north part of fulbaria,modhupur and merged at mymensingh zilla, south-east thrisal upazilla.It divided into twoparts and fall on ols Brahmaputra and lakkha river.

title: Bighai river(বিঘাই নদী)
content: It started to flow from mirzaganj and barguna zilla,amtali upazill,gulishakhali.It is the wide river in borguna zilla.

title: Bizni river(বিজনী নদী)
content: It originates from Tripura hill tracts and running over at brahmanbaria zilla,kpsba upazilla and merged with titash river.The length of the river is 7km.

title: Biriyana river
content: It started to flow from hobiganj zilla, north nabiganj upazilla and running over the north border  area of nabiganj upazilla.The length of the river is 35 km.

title: Bishkhali river
content: It originates from burisshor river of barishal.It covered the area of jhalkhati upazilla,create a huge turn over and gain started to flow toward south Bay-Of-Bengal.The length of the river is 96km.

title: Buriganga River
content: The Buriganga originated from the Dhaleshwari near Kalatia.  the flows past the southwest outskirts of Dhaka city,main flow of the Buriganga comes from the Turag. It meets with the Dhaleshwari at munshiganj. It ends dholesshari near narayanganj.The lengh of the river is 18 km.

title: Buritista river
content: It comes Bangladesh from india near domar upazilla border.The length of the river is 35 km.It merged with the tista river.

title: Burivodra river
content: It originates from kotakkho river and fall at vodra river.The is is important for the historical  activities.

title: Burisshor river
content: It originated from kittonkhola river and merged with bay of Bengal.It covered the area of ranirhaat,khairabad,lebukhali,bakerganj,ayla,buraghata etc.

title: Burisshor-payra river
content: It express itself from kobai river,dumki upazilla,patuakhali zilla.The length of the river is 70 km.It falls in Bay of Bengal.

title: Bullai river
content: It originated from nilfamari zilla and merged at also this zilla jamunesshore.The length of the river is 45 km.

title: Begbati river
content: It originated from chuadanga zilla and fall at  chitra river.I t covered the area of jinaidho.The length of the river is 72 km.It covered the area of jinadoho zilla,magura ilaa etc

title: Betna river
content: It originated from voirov and started to flow towards south. It running over Satkira zilla, Koloroa upazilla. Length is 192 km

title: Betmor river
content: Orginted from the middle part of puturia.

title: Betua river
content: It originate kheyaghat ,vola.It running over  vola city.historian said that it was canal in nimes.

title: Berong river
content: It originated from panhghar upazilla,tetulia upazilla nad entered darjiling ,india.The length of the river is 8 m.It covered border side area like  tetulia,panchgarg etc.The length of it is 8km.

title: Belai river
content: It comes from bagura zilla,pakuriya chor.It falls at chagoldhora and then bangla river.

title: Belan river(বেলান নদী)
content: It orgninated from shewlakhura.The length of the river is 25km.It merged with atria river.

title: Belua river ,(pirajpur)(বেলুয়া নদী-পিরোজপুর)
content: It originated from banaripara upaziila chowmohona.Rhe length of it is 40 km.It covered boitakatha bazar,kolar,doanea etc.

title: Boiran river
content: It originated from jinai river,modhupur upazilla,tangail zilla.It covered the area of gopalpur union.The length of the river 35 km.

title: Borka  river
content: It originated from the tetulia upazilla,panchghar zilla.It merged with chawai river.The length of the river 7 km.

title: Boulai river
content: It originated from khasia hill land entered mymensingh zilla.The length of the river is 48 km.It covered mymensingh ,sunamganj zilla etc.

title: Brahmaputra River
content: With its origin in the Angsi glacier, located on the northern side of the Himalayas in Burang County of Tibet as the Yarlung Tsangpo River, it flows across southern Tibet to break through the Himalayas in great gorges (including the Yarlung Tsangpo Grand Canyon) and into Arunachal Pradesh (India), where it

title: Bama River(বামা নদী)
content: It originated from tangain and covered the area of bamabari,bamarpar etc.This river has a great historicalimportance.

title: Bamni River(বামনী নদী)
content: It flows on the area of noakhali,siddhi bodu etc.

title: Bashar River
content: The river originated from the high lands of Madhupur and ended into the old Brahmaputra and Lakkha Rivers after passing Trishal in its way.

title: Barinda River
content: The river passed Mirjapur, Oyasi,Bahuriya, Shorai of Tangail and ended in the Bangshi River.

title: Bauri River
content: The river started from Sormaishar at Atpara and Kenduya in Netrokona and reached the border of Modon after flowing through Teligati.

title: Baoya River
content: This river originated from the Khashiya Mountain of India at the border near Jaintapur, Sylhet and ended in the Lain River.

title: Barjuri River
content: It started from Heliraikandi Beel of Jaintapur and ended in Ratukhal after passing Makadul Beel.

title: Boli River
content: This river started from Pagla Beel in the borders of Netrokona and Mohonganj and passed Gabindashree and Bainpur Beel on the way.

title: Borai River
content: It entered through the border of Dharmoshala and Sachona in Sunamganj and joined

title: Bogaliya River
content: It entered through Mirjapur in the border of Jakiganj and Badarpur in Sylhet and ended after joining the Kushiyara River while crossing Baurtoli Beel, Jabinpur, Karimganj, Khalachara, Ghorerbonder, Shadorshi and Chandoshrikonar in its way.

title: Baruni River
content: It started from Nayekpu which is near Modon and Tarail and reached Dhakuriya after taking a turn at Alamshri.

title: Bagkhali River
content: This river started from the forest area of Naikhangchari at Bandarban and passed Baishadi, Ramu and Cox’s Bazar before falling into the Bay of Bengal.

title: Boddar Khal
content: It flows between Hamdardiya and Sonadiya islands at Moheshkhali in Cox’s Bazar.

title: Bogadiya River
content: It came from between Pakshimul and Aorail in Sorail, Brahmanbariya and joined the Meghna River at Chunta.

title: Batakhasi River
content: It started from Muradnagar in Chandina, Comilla and passed Suhilpul and Kalichori River and flowed until Borokorai.

title: Bamu Khal
content: The river came from the East of Cox’s Bazar and passed Tanglaipara, Rigihatipara, Baishpara, Sanairupara, and Ramu before joining the Matamuhuri River.

title: Boro Farang Chara
content: A few charas came out from Chilopara, Galaiyapara, Vojapara in Ramu forest, Cox’s Bazar and joined together at Chadaghubibru and passed Kheduripara, Mochautpara, Sonachandrapara, Akirampara and Monijanapara before falling into Ramu Khal.

title: Batakhali River
content: The river started from the border of Kochuya Daudkandi in Chandina, Comilla and flowed through Suhilpur until the border of South Gollai.

title: Boyaljor River
content: This river originated from the Tripura hill tracks and enters into Bangladesh through Comilla-Tripura border and flows till the Kakri river.

title: Bodukuri River
content: It’s a branch of Andidit river situated at the border of Nobinagor and Brahmanbariya and joined the Titash river after passing Khagchali , Bilkindua ,Narusinheshor , Dashshoyel and Peyag.

title: Boyaljuri River
content: It’s started from the border of Hajigonj and Kochua in Chadpur and flows until Badda.

title: Bainkathi River
content: It started from Shorumkathi river at Pirojpur and flow until Attghor Kurikhana.

title: Chunar River
content: It originates from kaliganj upazila and end by meeting with Phepupetua river.

title: Chatra River
content: The Sirajgabj low land of Rajbari district is the origin place of this river and ends by meeting with Gorai river.

title: Chandona River
content: Padma river at Pangsha upazila(Rajbari) is the origin place of this river. Then it flows through Gopalganj and Faridpur before falling into Modhumoti river.

title: Cila River
content: It originates from Citramari of Khulna district and meets at Western Andhar Manik wit Salta river.

title: Charamaddi River
content: The Nehalganj river at Barisal district is the origin place of this river. Then it ends at Sajoal by meeting with Khairabad river.

title: Charamaddi River
content: The Char area of Nehalganj river at Barisal district is the origin place of this river and tenmeets with Khairabad river at Sajoal.

title: Chatra River
content: The chatra river originates from haor region of Pangsha Upazila, Rajbari. After flowing about 25 km it ends at Baliakandhi Upazila in the same district by meeting with Gorai river.It is tidal river.

title: Chinadhar River
content: It started flowing from Kaliaghata and fall into Gatua Beel.

title: Chunai Gang
content: It started flowing from Ambari of Dharmapasha Upazilla of Sunamganj and flows upto Shater kandi.

title: Chatal River
content: It started from the Jamuna River in Jamalpur, flowed through Madarganj and Sharishabari and falls into Jhinai or Jamuna River.

title: Chomparay Chara
content: It originated from the Rajkandi Mountain at Tripura and falls into Dholai River after joining Chommachora at Sylhet.

title: Chargang
content: The river started from a swamp situated between Shantipur and Khoyerpur at Lakhai, Kishorganj and ended in the estuary of Kalni and Dhalashwari River after passing Digadar Beel, Goyeshpur and joining with Chatagang Beel and Chaya Beel.

title: Chera River
content: It started from the Kalni River at Karimganj in Kishorganj and passed Paradoh Beel, Bapna Beel then dividing into three parts at Fulpur Borodiya beel started towards Patharikandi and Khagrakandi.

title: Chotadhani River
content: This river genesis from Noyahat of Nageshwari Upazilla, Kurigram that patch up with Bara Dham Beel at South Ramaghona.

title: Churamati
content: Two streams come out from Dalkolia Beel and Naldeghi of Pirganj Upazilla, Thakurgaon that meets at Brddiogao, after that it enters West Dinajpur (West Bengal) through Varkatpara.

title: Chinar Kup River
content: Which river generated from Padma river at Godagari Upazilla, Rajshahi and flowing sequence of Islampur village center, known as Chinar Kup river.

title: Chenakata River
content: One streams which comes out from Mukta Lake and other streams that originated between Tepurgari and jotrup Chand joined with each other near North – West of Bashkata. After that extent flow taken name as Chenakata river.

title: Chockarabti River
content: Originated from Chiknai river at Majhapara Union, Atgharia Upazilla, Pabna which traveling through Atgharia, Iswardi and again fall into same river.

title: Chandraborti River
content: This river flows within parallel to Iswardi – Atgharia upazilla boundary of Pabna.

title: Charkada River
content: This river comes between Nimgachi and Berer Bari of Bogra Sadar that flows up to Sherpur through Seildhukri, Beelchapri, Kantanagar and Elenga.

title: Chaoi / Chaoayi River
content: This river derived from Jalpaiguri district, India that enter Bangladesh through Jamadar Para, Panchagarh Sadar Upazilla and meets with Korotoya river at Kishorpara.

title: Chaoli River
content: Which river flows parallel to the North – West boundary of Panchagarh Upazilla and West Bengal and advanced Jogadal Hat and Kazipara through Amarkhana, is recognized as Chaoli River.

title: Charalbon River
content: This river ousted from Boikushnopur of Thakurgaon Sadar and meets with Sinua river at Chakoyapara.

title: Chota Sinua River
content: Generated from jalali area of Thakurgaon Sadar Upazilla that finished at Chameshwari through Tepu Hamrihat, Vatgaon, Kachubari and Krishnopur.

title: Chari
content: Chari river starts from Dudhnai and ends at the Bagrabhita bil.

title: Chunkhai
content: Chunkhai jhora starts from the Shwameshwari river and ends at the Chinakur bil.

title: Churkhai
content: Chorkhai river starts from the Barira river and ends at the estuary of Sutai river.

title: Chinai
content: Chinai river starts from Khaliyajuri and first stream ends at Surai.

title: Chila
content: Chila river starts from Madan and ends at the boundary of Atpara.

title: Chilmari River
content: It takes off from Nabaganga river at Mehendiganj upazila of Barisal district and ends at Biddantapur by meeting with Arial Khan river.

title: Chota River
content: The low land at Meherpur district is the source region of this river and it meets wit Kajli river at Rajon-nogor.

title: Chapdi
content: Chapdi river starts from Beldoba and ends at the Nanglai river.

title: Chandi
content: Chandi river starts from Tengra and first stream ends at the Gazlu bil, second stream ends at the Khajanchi river.

title: Chagolnaiya Chora
content: The river originated from the Tripura Hill tracks and ended in the Mohuri river after passing Ramnagar, Andharmanik, Panoyar and Kashimpur at Feni.

title: Dignar River
content: It originates from the Kumar river at Mukshudpur upazila of Gopalganj district and ends at the lower Modhumoti.

title: Dolua River
content: It emerges from Tala and Sadar upazila of Shatkhira district and then flows upto Kapotakkho river

title: Dankhali River
content: Tiakhali river is the orgin area of this river that is at Amtoli upazila and then ends by meeting with Tepua river.

title: Dhamsidha river
content: This river takes off from Rajapur upazila’s Jonglia river and then ends by meeting with Bishkhali river

title: Dhulia River
content: It originates from the Bakergonj and Bhola Upazila region and ends by meeting with Kharkhana river at Roghunathpur.

title: Dhanshiddho River
content: The boundary of Jhalkathi upazila and Rajpur upazila is te source area of this river that follows upto  kandar of Char Vatara and falls into Gojalia river

title: Dighijan Gang River
content: It originates from Chitolmari upazila of Pirojpur district and falls into Kaliganga river at Arabat.

title: Dhanaikhali River
content: It started flowing from Alga Bakur Beel of Mymensingh district and fall into Dholai River at Darun Sahata and flows upto Shyampur through Dhauli Beel, Desh Bhagia and Ramkumara Beel.

title: Dalia River
content: This river originated from Dahuka River of Sunamganj and fall into Bugar Khadipur Haor through Khirpura, Kalkalia and Mukampur.

title: Dema River
content: It started flowing from Bandar Dubia Beel of Nabiganj Upazilla of Habiganj and then divided into two parts. One fall into Beri Beel and another mixed with Borak river at Kuligaon.

title: Dirai River
content: It started flowing from Noagaon Mor and Bholanagar with Mora Gang naming as Dirai River and then divided into two parts. One flows upto Gobindapur and the other fall in Surma and Kalni River.

title: Dona River
content: It started flowing from Meghalaya of India and entered into Bangladesh through Dona Khristianbanti of Kanaighat, Sylhet and fall into Surma River at Narayanpur.

title: Dhamna River
content: It started flowing from Khalipur Beel of Mymensingh and flows upto Adura Beel. It’s a part of Raijan River.

title: Dahuka River
content: It started flowing from Asda Beel of Chatak and Jagannathpur and flows through Goyeshpur.

title: Duman Khal
content: It started flowing from Kamasrichak of Ajmiriganj and Baniachang and flows upto Kushiara.

title: Dewrai River
content: It started flowing from North of Putizana at Fulbaria and Muktagacha Upazilla  and joined with Akhila River at the south of Fulbaria city.

title: Deor River
content: It started flowing from Denar Beel of Fulpur Upazilla and ended upto south of Katla Beel.

title: Dobazar Khal
content: It started flowing from Khasia Pahar of India and fall into Surma at Kubatola.

title: Dhamalia River
content: It started flowing from Khasia Pahar of India and flows beside Kalpanagarh reserve forest in Sunamganj and then it enters Tahirpur Upazilla through Purangaon.

title: Deochiri River
content: It started flowing from two originating points. One point is from Meghalaya of India which enters into Bangladesh through Kanaighat and fall into Lova River and the other point is from Kachar district of Assam. It enters into Bangladesh through Mikirpara and falls intoLova River.

title: Deoral River
content: It started from between Boro –Gram and Dullar in Mymensingh ang join the Banar River at Daogaway after flowing through Kashimpur and Kalia Beel.

title: Doluya Chara and Bagha Chara
content: They started from the Raikandi forestland in Sylhet and falls into Goler Haor after passing Kathalkandi , kanaidash , tarasingho gao , sripur and Bandhari gao.

title: Dudhai
content: It started from the Panchat and Boyra Swamp at etna , kishorgonj and falls into The dhonu river at ferry ghat after passing Kamarpur, kandipara, Shimla and Barshikubar.

title: Daina River
content: It started from the Rahilan river in Mymensingh and ended in the Varpur swamp after crossing Chapila, Panchahar, Tengrabari and Tengara.

title: Dar River
content: It started from the Bainavi Beel, passed Rudar pudda, Dharishwar and ended in the Chatara and Kubsa beel.

title: Dakni River
content: It started flowing from the Hular khal in Sherpur and passed Gopalbila bazar and Dakurpar before falling in the Dakai Beel.

title: Deor River
content: It started from the south of Katlabeel in Fulpur, Mymensingh and ended in the Dhalai River after passing Femar beel.

title: Dubri river(ধুবড়ি নদী)
content: From khasia hill, India it started to flow and merged with piyain gang.

title: Dema gang(ডেমা গাং)
content: It was originated from Sunamganj zilla and merged with boka river.

title: Doratana River
content: Takes off from Bhairab river at Sadar Upazila of Bagerhat that fall into Ghoshiakhali and Poylahara river of Rampal Upazilla (Bagerhat). River length is 21 km. Width is 350 meters and depth is 14 meters. The area of river catchment is 80 sq. km.

title: Dignar River
content: It is a small river that flows within Maksudpur Upazilla.

title: Dudhkumar River
content: This river locate on the northern boundary of Bangladesh. Its birth’s place is mainly Sikkim State of India. Dhorla and Dudhkumar rivers flow mutually together with parallel to the Tista river. In Rangpur district Nilkumar river also joined with this. This river also meets with Fulkumar river.

title: Deonai – Charalkata – Jamuneshwari River
content:
This river originated from Beel areas of Domar Upazilla (Nilphamari) that flows through Domar, Jaldhaka, Taraganj, Badargonj, Mithapukur and Nawabganj Upazilla and finally discharged in Korotoya river at Nawabganj Upazilla.
Length of this river is 163 km. Width is 50 meters and catchment size is 750 sq. km.
On the bank of this river Badarganj Pourosova, Baluya Masumpur Bandar are located. This river has 5 bridges (Taraganj, badarganj, Choralkata, Baluya Masumpur, & Milonpur).

title: Deluti River
content:
This river ousted from Gangrail river that fallen into Shibsha River at Paikgacha Upazilla (Khulna).
The length, width and depth of this river respectively 20 km, 350 meters and 13.50 meters. River catchment area is 20.43 km. Stream of this river is monsoon nature. This river influenced by ebb and tide.

title: Dhonagoda River
content:
This river derived from Meghna – Gumti river at Daudkandi Upazilla, Comilla that crosses Daudkandi and Matlab (North) which falls in the upstream of Meghna near Matlab (South) Upazilla, Chandpur.
Meghna – Dhongoda Irrigation project is situated on this river catchment.
The length of this river is 45 km. Width is 200 meters and depth is 15 meters. Catchment size of this river is 38.78 sq. km. Water flow continued throughout the year. But rate is low in February – March.
Ebb – tide regularly show.  As river is flood prone, dam is built on the right bank that length is 35 km.

title: Dhonu River
content:
This river flows from Balu river at Jamalganj Upazilla (Sunamganj) that is joined with Meghna river at Bajitpur Upazilla (Kishorganj). On the flowing way this river travelled through Mohonganj, Khaliajuri, Itna, Mithamain, Austogram, Nikli, Bajitpur, Bhairab, & Kuliachar Upazilla.
Length of this river is 120 km. Width is 100 meters. River catchment area is 700 sq. km. Depth is 8 meters.
Water flow all times of the year. This river is free from ebb and tide but drenched by flood.

title: Dhormoganj River
content: On the East side of Hijla Upazilla, created estuary of three rivers. One river comes from Joyonti river as Meghna from Muladi border and another comes from Mehendiganj taking name as Ajimpur river and joined together. From joined place, create combined stream flow that known as Dhormoganj river which discharged into Lower Meghna at the boundary zone between Hijla and Mehendiganj Upazilla. This river created Dhupkhola islands after 2 km flow on the east side.

title: Dhorla River
content:
The birth place of this river is Northern Reserve forest of Lower Tandu, Jalpaiguri District of West Bengal, India. It enters Bangladesh through Changrabandha of Patgram Upazilla, Lalmonirhat.
It meets with Brahmaputra river near Kurigram district.
Length of this river in Bangladesh is 75 km.
It has small tributary in Rangpur district name as Nilkumar.

title: Dhola River
content: This is the river of Netrokona district. This river flows from Fulpur (Mymensingh) to Purbahhala, and on the side of the Atpara Upazilla.

title: Dhola River
content: This river genesis from Doba channel that comes from Assam – Meghalaya states of India, through Piyain river (linked with Piyain in Bangladesh at Companyganj Upazilla, Sylhet) meets with Surma. Length of this river is 90 km. Width is 945 meters. And catchment size is 70 sq. km. Ebb and tide free river.

title: Dholai River
content:
Source of this river is Eastern hill of Tripura (India). From that place, it flows on the north sides and enter Bangladesh through Kamalganj Upazilla, Moulvibazar and joint with Manu river.
Length of this river is 40 km. width is 50meter. Catchment size is 342 sq. km.

title: Dholeshwar Nod
content: It’s starting from Mativanga (Barisal) that meets with Kocha river near Kuyetpur.

title: Dholeshwari River
content:
Known as Veramohona which isn’t main river. Kalni, Bibiyana etc. linked at Ajmiriganj that created a large stream which crossed almost 72 km to meet with Meghna.
It flows as demarcated boundary between Sylhet & Mymensingh district.

title: Dholeshwari River
content:
It is the tributary of Jamuna river. It coming out from Jamuna river at Saliamabad of Mymensingh. Via Vuyapur, Tangail Sadar, Nagarpur, Saturiya, Keraniganj, Munshiganj and Narayanganj, it’s discharged into Meghna river.
Length of this river is 168 km. Width is 697 meters. Depth is 6 meters. Size of catchment area is 7253 sq. km.
Water flow remaining all years round.

title: Dholeshwari River
content:
This river out from Atrai river that again meets with Atrai at Sadar Upazilla, Dinajpur. Dinazpur city and Sahebganj built up on the bank of this river.
Length of this river is 17 km and width is 100 meters. River catchment size is 40 sq. km.
The water flow of this river is about withers in the drying season.

title: Dhaijan River
content:
This river originated from Dorivija Beel at Jaldhaka Upazilla, Nilphamari which fall into Jamuneshwari river of Kishoreganj Upazilla.
Length of this river is 29 km. and width is 60meters. Depth of this river is 2.5 meters. Catchment size is 100 sq. km.
Stream remaining whole years.

title: Dhnabandha River
content: This is the river that comes out from Jamuna river, which streaming via Sirajganj to meet again at Fuljor.

title: Dhanasimri River
content: The birth place of Dhanasimri river is Naga Hill of Naga State, India. This river merged near Majuli Island of Brahmaputra.

title: Dhanasimri River
content: A river of Barisal District which now turned into a narrow lake as deposition of silts, and aquatic plants and grasses on the both side of river. Waters remain in rainy monsoon but its remains dry most period of a year.

title: Dhum River
content: This river originated from Low land area of Khagakhari Bari, Dimla Upazilla that discharged into Buritista river at Jaldhaka Upazilla, Nilphamari. Catchment area has 51 sq. km. The length of this river is 17.5 km and width is 35 meters. Depth is 2.5 meters.

title: Dhap River
content: This river derived from Atrai river at Shomvuganj of Birgaj Upazilla that travels up to Dinajpur.

title: Dhanjan River
content: Comes out between Syedpur and Kishoreganj Upazilla that falls into Jamuneshwari river at South Dura Kuthi.

title: Deadly Padma River
content: This river derived from Padma River at BP 172 and 170 (Chapai Nawabganj – West Bengal Border Area) and finally falls into the same river at Charuisha.

title: Duddura River
content: This river takes off from Neamotpur of Syedpur Upazilla, Nilphamari that fallen into Chikli river at Western side of Radhanagar Pathangarh.

title: Dudiyamoni River
content: This river comes out from Arji Rator (Thakurgaon Sadar) that fallen into Korna Beel.

title: Doya River
content: This river originated from Sharamangola river at Jamalpur Mouja, Rajshahi City that meets with Raichand river at Uttarpara, Hariya.

title: Dima and Sakra River
content: Three streams come out from North – West Deghalbalak of Nabiganj Upazilla, Habiganj. One of them meets at North – East Enathganj, Second at East Baradal Beel and third one patch up near North side of Enathganj. After that first one fallen into Beri Beel; second and third discharged into Barak river through South side of Kollashganj Majar. Here river taken name as Sakra and Dima.

title: Dhupikhali River
content: This river derived between Hatli Beel and Medni of Netrokona Sadar that flows up to the boundary of Netrokona.

title: Dhalia River
content: This river takes off from West – North side of Bagua Beel at Kala, Netrokona Sadar Upazilla that advances up to Pourasova.

title: Doina River
content: This river ousted from North – East Hoyarbeel at Gaforgaon Upazilla, Mymensingh and discharged in Banar river at Kapashia Border.

title: Dara River
content: Which streams flow from Pialmari via Durlavpur to estuary of Pagla river at Kalupur (Shipganj Upazilla, Nawabganj) known as Dara river.

title: Dead Ganges River
content: It’s ousted from North – West Monakosha of Shipganj Upazilla, Chapi Nawabganj that joined with Pagla river at Shatrujitpur.

title: Dhabalsati River
content: Derived from Uparsara of Lalmonirhat District that comes up to Patgram, known as Dhabalsati River.

title: Dhuli River
content: The stream which starting from Balorampur of Atwari Upazilla (Dinajpur) and advanced Thakurgaon through Debipur, known as Dhuli river.

title: Dhoramula
content: Dhoramula river starts from the Kangsa river and first stream ends at the Bishkhali river, second stream ends at Sunaikanda, third stream ends at the Kalihar river.

title: Darji
content: Darji jhora starts from the conjunction of Debram & Netari streams and ends at the Chinakur bil.

title: Dair/Deyar
content: Dair/Deyar gang starts from the Kalni riverl and again ends at the Kalni river.

title: Dariya
content: Dariya river starts from Kalinagar and ends at the Marsi river.

title: Dana
content: Dana gang starts from Dona tea garden and ends at the Surma river.

title: Dosi
content: Dosi gang starts from the Khashiya hill and ends at choto Daud.

title: Dewdiya
content: Dewdiya river starts from Andharpara and ends at the Malijhi river.

title: Dholir Khal
content: Dholir khal starts from Chuniya and ends at the Ratai bil.

title: Dulta
content: Dulta river starts from the Latifpur haor and ends at Fekul Mohammad.

title: Dakni
content: Dakni river starts from the Dakai bil and first stream ends at  Gurkona, second stream ends at the Malijhi river.

title: Dhupir Hala
content: Dhupir Hala river starts from Jagati & Baje Subnodiya and ends at Moradighi & Mohanpur.

title: Dighali
content: Dighali gang starts from Farbanga and ends at Pupafi.

title: Dudhai River
content: A mountain-originated thin river that passed Itna and Khalijuri of Kishorgonj and Haripur and ended in the Dhanu River.

title: Doshani River
content: This river has a lot of sources and it passed Mymensingh, Gaibandha, Kusholnogor, Sherpur, etc on its way.

title: Dengar River
content: It started from Medhar Haor situated at Kanaighat in the south of Jaintapur, Sylhet and flowed until Heliraikandi.

title: Daira River
content: The river that flows through Fulpur at Kaoyar in Mithamail in Kishorganj is known as Daira river.

title: Dhar Gang
content: It started from the Borai river in Sunamganj and it passed Dharchak, Haripur, Deolabar, Saitani Khal in its way.

title: Edgaon River
content: Edgaon river starts from the Edgaon hill, Coxsbazar and ends at the Maheshkhali channel. It covers Edgaon bazar,Coxsbazar. The total length of the river is 20 km.

title: Falki River(ফালকি নদী)
content: It emerges from Horinakunda and Sadar upazila of Jhinaidaha district and then flows upto Kalicharanpur

title: Firi River
content: It started flowing from Omarpur of Suria River and Mostafapur at Dirai Upazilla of Sunamganj and flows upto Doulatpur.

title: Fira Gang
content: It started flowing from Zabarkona of Dharmapasha Upazilla of Sunamganj and flows upto Boro Beel.

title: Fanai Gang
content: It started flowing from several streams at Muraichora Bazar of Sylhet and flows upto Bhabanipur.

title: Fulbariya River
content: It came out from the south ferighat of Baulai river In Karimganj, Kishorganj and flows till east ferighat of Baulai river after passing Chata Bilayat and Baghaiya on the way.

title: Fokirni River
content:
This river generated from Atrai river at Manda Upazilla, Naogaon that fallen into Bagmara Upazilla, Rajshahi.
Length of this river is 40 km. Width is 65 meters and depth is 5.5 meters. Size of basin is 272 sq. km.
Water flow don’t continue throughout the year. And no influence of ebb and tide.

title: Fotka River
content:
This river out from Chitra river at Kaliganj Upajilla, Jhenaidah that fall again into Chitra at Shalikha Upazilla (Magura) through Magura Sadar.
River length is 35 km. Width is 300 meters. Depth is 5.5 meters. Catchment size is 150 sq. km.
Stream flow continued all year round. No effect of ebb and tide.

title: Fotki River
content:
This river coming out from Noboganga river at Sadar Upazilla, Magura that fall into Chitra river.
Length of this river is 35 km. Width is 150 meters. Depth is 5.5 meters. Basin size is 150 sq. km. Water flow remaining whole years.

title: Fulkumar River
content:
This river generated in India that enter Bangladesh through Nageswari Upazilla, Kurigram and fallen into Dudhkumar river.
River length is 25.5 km, width is 90 meters, depth is 2.5 meters, and Catchment size is 80 sq. km.

title: Fediya River
content: Ousted from Rajganj river at Bakerganj Border area (North side of Patuakhali Upazilla) and patch up with Muadia Don at Laukathi. Finally fall into Lohaliya river.

title: Feni River
content:
Feni river, which demarcated the boundary line between Chittagong, Noakhali, and Tripura of Assam, originated from the mountain region of Assam and fallen into Bay of Bengal.
Total length of this river is 115.85 km. In Bangladesh its length is 80 km. Depth is 10 meters. Width is 150 meters. Catchment size is 126 sq. km.

title: Fuljan River
content: This river generated from Korotoya river at Ullapara Upazilla, Sirajganj that discharged into Ohala river at Kayamkela.

title: Fuluya
content: Fuluya river starts from the Tengra bil and one stream ends at the Gangar khal, another stream ends at the Gujarkandi bil.

title: Fonoya
content: Fonoya jhora starts from Nayapara and one stream ends at the Gopalpur jhora, another stream ends at Durgapur.

title: Feri Gang
content: Feri gang starts from the Bibiyana river and ends again at the Bibiyana river.

title: Futjani River
content: Futjani river starts from the lowland of Karatiyapara and first stream ends at Mirjapur, second stream ends at the Fursama river, third stream ends at the Bangsi river.

title: Fulua
content: Fulua river starts from the Hangarpur bil and ends at the Barbhanga river.

title: Fira
content: Fira gang starts from Boldabil and ends at the Dhanu river.

title: Fulchara
content: Fulchara river starts from Nandicharan and ends at the Hail haor.

title: Fum River
content: The river started from Vobanipur, Ajmiriganj and joined Verameni River before falling into the Singara Beel.

title: Fuldi River
content: This river started from two parts of Meghna river and again fall into the Meghna river after crossing Atiknagar, Abalitala, Vaterchar, Srimantadi, Husaindi, Charsaheban, Rusulpur, Doulatpur and Talbana.

title: Goneshpura River
content: This river emerges from the boundary line of Mehendiganj (Barisal) and Bhola sadar upazila and ends at Char Gopalpur of Bhola district

title: Gonesshori River
content: It originates from Komalakanda upazila and ends at Patharia upazila.

title: Gona River
content: It originates from Mongla river and flows through Abad and Buridanga and then meets with Ichamoti river.

title: Greater Pangsha River
content: Arpangashia river is the source area of this river at Shatkhira district. This river ends at Malancha estuary.

title: Gojalia River
content: This river emerges from Jhalkathia district and flows through this region and then falls at Nolcity.

title: Gajalla River
content: The boundary of Jhalkathi upazila and Rajpur upazila is te source area of this river that follows upto Mahadipur.

title: Gacha River
content: Shahabajpur of Shatkhira district is the origin place of this river. It ends by meeting with Gosh Ghoshia river.

title: Ghoshkhali River
content: The kanakhali and Hogla Char of Khulna district is the source region of this river and it then ends at shibsa river at kumar khali.

title: Gupe River
content: The sadar upazila of Khulna district is the origin place of this river and then falls into Rupsha river.

title: Gaokhali River
content: It originates from Botiagata upazila of Khulna district that ends by meeting wit low-land of gaukali.

title: Gang River
content: It is the one of the three major drainage systems of Bangladesh.  is atrans-boundary river of Asia which flows through the nations of India and Bangladesh. The 2,525 km (1,569 mi) river rises in the western Himalayas in the Indian state ofUttarakhand, and flows south and east through theGangetic Plain of North India into Bangladesh. After entering Bangladesh, the main branch of the Ganges is known as the Padma. The Padma is joined by the Jamuna River, the largest distributary of the Brahmaputra. Further downstream, the Padma joins the Meghna River, the second largest distributary of the Brahmaputra, and takes on the Meghna’s name as it enters the Meghna Estuary, which empties into the Bay of Bengal.

title: Gangadhar River
content: This river follows through Bohalkuri and Choddakuri and then Nagesshari of Kurigram district and ends by meeting with Dudhkumar River.

title: Gongaliya River
content: The flowage through Betagi from Jhalakathi is known as Gongaliya River that’s ends by meeting with Bishkhali River.

title: Gajaria River
content: The river that originates from the Karatoya River at Greater Rangpur district and then flows through Northern Bogura to meet with Ichamati river, is known as Gajaria river.

title: Gajalia River
content: It originates from the Khairabad river at the boundary of two district of Barisal and Jhalakathi. It indicates the boundary between Barguna and Jhalakathi district.

title: Godai River
content: It originates from Musakhan river at Sadar Upazila of Natore Distric and end at the same district at Singra Upazilla after following 20 km. It is a seasonal river without any seasonal effect.

title: Goneshpura River
content: It is a tributary of lower Meghna that originates from Hilshaghat and flows to Tolaghat naming Goneshpura. Then it ends meeting with Bay of Bengal as a name Tentolia.

title: Govesshori River
content: It originates from the Atrai river at Sadar Upazilla of Dinajpur district and then also meets with the same river at the same upazilla. The length of the river is 17 km with 100m of width.

title: Golachipa River
content: It originates from the Lohalia river (originally a part of this river) at Amkhali, Patuakhali district and then also meets at Barbonaya Channel of Patuakhali.

title: Gorai River
content: It is the major tributary river of Ganga. At the upper stream it is known as Gorai that flows from Talbaria Upazilla, Kustia to Mohammadpur upazilla, Narail.  And at the lower stream, it is known as Modhumati River. Total length of the river is 89 km with average width 450 meter.

title: Ganganoi River
content: It originates from the low-land Damukdah of Shibganj Upazila, Borura District and meets with Nagor-karatoya river at the same region. The total length of the river is about 18 km with 27.5 meter of width.

title: Gazikhali River
content: It is one of the major tributary of Dholesshori River. It is believed that the river named after Sufi’s (Gazi) of  Bhawal Region. It originates from Shaturiya Upazila of Manikganj district and meets with Bangshi River near Savar, Dhaka.

title: Guingajuri River
content: It has emanated from the Hakaluki Haor region of Barlekha Upazila, Moulvibazar.  It runs through Srimangal and Hobiganj and ends by meeting with the river Balikhal. Its length is about 60 km along with 20 meter width.

title: Gudi River
content: Starting from the Veramohona lowland (bill) of Salla Upazilla, Sunamjganj, it ends at Dhanpur canal located at Itna Upazila of Kishoreganj District after flowing about 6 km wit 70 meter of width.

title: Guddi River
content: The river is located at Sadar Upazila of Natore District and ends near Shawal meeting with BArnai-Gudi river after flowing only 8 km.

title: Gunakhali River
content: This river has been originated from the Salta river and ends by meeting with Deluti river at the same Upazila, Paikgasa, Khulna. It flows about 10 km. along with 150 meter width. It has an direct tidel effect.

title: Gulishakhali River
content: It originates from the Paira river and again meets with it after flowing about 14 km through Sadar Upazila of Patuakhali District.

title: Gurr River
content: The Northern Shakhai of Atrai river is known as Gurr river. The length of this river is 15 km.

title: Gurrnai River
content: After originating from Atrai river (at Gurrdaspur Upazila of Natore district), it meets with Boral river at Chatmohon upazila of this district. Total length of this river is 50 km and width is 150 meter.

title: Gopla River
content: It is a river of Moulvibazar District. It has been originated from Srimangol Upazila’s and ends at Hail haor (low-land).

title: Gobra River
content: The river has been originated from low-land at Tentulia upazila of Panchgarh district and after flowing only 4 km through Bangladesh, it enters into Darjiling district of India.

title: Gomati River
content: The river originates from th North-Eastern hilly region of Tripura state of India. Then it flows about 150 km through india and enters into Bangladesh through Comilla district. Total length of this river is 135 km in Bangladesh. It is flashy river.

title: Gumani River
content: It emanates from Atrai river at Chatmohon, Pabna and ends by meeting with Boral river at Faridpur upazila of this District. Length of this river is 25 km with width of 65 meter. It has no tidal effect on this river.

title: Goalgheshia river
content: The length of this river is 25 km with width of 80 meter that emerges from Habra river at Kaliganj upazila, Shatkhira District. It meets with Kholapatua River at Ashashuni upazila.

title: Gangrail River
content: The river rises from the Vadra river located at Dumuria upazila of Khulna district and end at the same region after flowing about 25 km. It has a direct tidal effect.

title: Gohala River
content: The another flowage of Kochia river is known as Gohala river. It is located at Ramkantapur upazila of Pabna district and then falls in Hurasagor river.

title: Goali River
content: The former name of this river was Paruli that located at Gazipur District. The historic Rajbari of the Bhawals are at the Northern side of this river.

title: Ghanraj River
content: The location of the river is 22’42’’N to 22’38’’ N latitude and 89’24’’ E to 89’25’’ E longitude. Chengail river falls into shibsa river and then names as Ghanaraj river.

title: Ghanteshari River
content: In the middle era, Ghanteshari was a mighty river. But now it is alike a canal without about no flowage.

title: Ghoshiakhali River
content: Originally it was a canal that has been artificially originated. To make a connection with Mongla and Panguchi river, this 5 km long canal has been cut off.

title: Ghaghot River
content: It is a tributary of Tista river that has been originated at Jaldhaka upazila, Nilphamari and then meets with Brahmaputra river at Gaibandha district. It is a 236 km long river.

title: Ghaghor River
content: After originating from the Paisha river at Agailjhara Upazila, Barisal, it flows about 35 km and then ends by meeting with Modhumoti river at Tungipara Upazila, Gopalganj. It has a direct tidal effect.

title: Ghirnai River
content: It has been originates from the lower land of Sayedpur upazila, Nilphamari district. Then it meets with the Karotoya river at Nababganj upazila. It is 20 km long and 20 meter wide.

title: Ghungur River
content: It is 35 km long and 15 meter wide river that originates from Hilly region at Tripura state and then enters into Bangladesh through Comilla district. Then meets with mighty Salda river at Kosba upazila.

title: Ghorautra River
content: It is a 45 km long river that originates from Dhonu river at Mithamoin upazila of Kisharganj District and then meets with kalni-Meghna river at Bajitpur upazila.

title: Ghorakhali River
content: It is a river that locates at Narail District, Lohagara Upazila. It has a short history about its naming. People believe  that it was a canal that cut off by  a Salt Businessman.

title: Ghorakhali River
content: It is a river that locates at Narail District, Kalia Upazila. People believe  that it was a canal that cut off by  a Salt Businessman.

title: Ghoramara River
content: It is a borderline river  that emerge from Jalpaiguri district of India and enters into Bangladesh through Panchagarh. It ends by meeting with Karotoya river at deviganj. It has a length of 13 km and a wide of 100 meter.

title: Gonai River
content: It started flowing from Radinanagar, Sujanagar and Nikli Beel of Sunamganj district and fall into Laredigha River.

title: Gangiajuri River
content: It started flowing from Gangiajuri Beel of Bijni River at Habiganj and fall into Bali River and estuary of Borak River.

title: Gouramani River
content: It started flowing from Jurig Haor of Habiganj Sadar Upazilla and fall into Sutang River at Shahjibazar.

title: Goainghat Gang
content: It started flowing from East border of Goainghat Upazilla, Sylhet and fall into Singer Khal.

title: Ghior Khal
content: It started flowing from an old flow of Dhaleshwari and fall into Ichamati River.

title: Ghanura River
content: This river originated from Kandilota Beel and passed Rukshar  hawor , Holdipur , poranpur, Chelhan, sadar gao  , molitan pur , adia beel and flows until Patali.

title: Gorgora River
content: It started from the nort-east of Telahati in Sripur and ended in the Lobondoho river after going through Maona, Sripur and Gazipur.

title: Gorai River
content: Stream which comes out as a Zigzag pattern from North side of Naodanga Kuthir (Nagehwari and Vurungamari Upazilla, Kurigram) that discharged into Girai river at Gopalpur.

title: Girai River
content: The stream which comes out from Chatiya Beel, lakharganj and Naodanga Khuthi of Kurigram Sadar Upazilla, meets with Chota Dhani river.

title: Gukkhir Khari
content: 3 unique streams that outs from Dhamuir Hat Upazilla (Naogaon) and West Dinajpur District that meets at middle of the Talabari and Hat Nagar that discharged into Jamuna river at Kharipur.

title: Ghagra River
content: This river derived between Bauna para and Chingipur of West Dinajpur District that fallen into Jamuna river at Isabpur.

title: Gunduri River
content: This is border river that outs between Kholra and Nurpur of Haripur Upazilla, Thakurgaon that falls into Vugot Beel.

title: Ghorgharia River
content: This river generated from Paragach of Sundarganj Upazilla, Gaibandha that confluenc with Brahmaputra river at Tobakpur.

title: Gudi River
content: This river genesis from Mohana Beel at Vera of Salla Upazilla, Sunamganj that joined with Dhanupur Khal at Itna.

title: Gopalpur River
content: The tributary of Dead Padma River that flows from Batrish to Monakosha of Kanshat, Shibganj Upazilla, known as Gopalpur river.

title: Goyala River
content: Two unique streams that coming out from Hatgram and Sahatpur Lakes, travels through Goyalgao this two streams confluence at Western side of Deghaparsho Bari, after crossing few distance its taking a bent and finally fallen into Dhaniyabaria and Parshobari Beel.

title: Gohala River
content: This river coming out from Buri, Potajia and Ramkantapur (Border area of Chatmohar, Shahjadpur and Sathiya Upazilla, Pabna) that divided near north – eastern side of Dokholbaria, Potajia and Raotbaria.

title: Gopalganj Khari
content: Which river genesis from Kurali Beel at Porsha Upazilla, Naogaon and ends near India – Bangladesh Border, known as Gopalganj Khari

title: Giriya River
content: Ousted from Hudumdanga Swamps of Deowanganj Hat at Nilphamari Uapzilla and meets with Buri Tista near Basmansingh.

title: Gobra River
content: Take birth from North – Eastern Beel of Western Sadar Para, Tetulia Upazilla that keep up Tetulia town on the West and enters Darjeeling.

title: Gabrur Dara
content: After crossing one – mile Circle Route near Jamalpur, Gaibandha Sadar Upazilla, confluence streams taken name as Gabrur Dara and meets with Ghaghat at Parjurat.

title: Ghoghalghati River
content: This river ousted between Dhulia and Southpara of Syedpur Upazilla that stream flows up to Mathurampur.

title: Gulaikhali
content: Gulaikhali river starts from the Nagura bil and one stream ends at the Bolam Mura river, another stream ends at the Jhonjel bil.

title: Gushkhali
content: Gushkhali river starts from Niyapara Sonakanda and ends at Chaturi.

title: Gulaghat
content: Gulaghat river starts from Durgasrom & Lakshmipur and ends at the Mitli bil.

title: Gunal
content: Gunal river starts from the Meghna bil and ends at the Mashimpur bil.

title: Guzarmari
content: Guzarmari river starts from the Ubdakhali river and ends at Ranigaon.

title: Gupla
content: Gupla gang starts from the Bituya haor and one stream ends at the Barak river, another stream also ends at the Barak river.

title: Ghumira
content: Ghumira river starts from Katabari and one stream ends at the Ramkhali river.

title: Gailpur
content: Gailpur jhora starts from Hatiber Giri and ends at Kalikapara & Noyapara.

title: Ghairgai
content: Ghargai river starts from Digholbhag and ends at the Kushiyara river.

title: Gaujaghata
content: Gaujaghata river starts from the the Jamuna river and again ends at the Jamuna river.

title: Gopla
content: Gopla river starts from Gopal bazar and ends at the Hail haor. Another course starts from the Hail haor and ends at the Kushiyara river.

title: Garial
content: Garial gang starts from the Ditabil and first stream ends at the Sonawoya bil, second stream ends at the Taruba gang.

title: Gokhra
content: Gokhra river starts from the Garabhanga river and ends at the Berachapra river.

title: Garabhanga
content: Garabhanga river starts from the Borobil and ends at the Gokhra river.

title: Guba
content: Guba khal starts from Harin dhora and ends at the Bangsi river.

title: Ghardaiyar
content: Ghardaiyar river starts from the Bannari river and first stream ends at the Kheya bil, second stream ends at the Dhanu river.

title: Ghorakhali River
content: The sadar upazila of Jessore and Terkhada upazila is the origin area of this river and then meets with Beki river.

title: Gojariya River
content: It originated from the Tripura and joined the Kahur River after passing Chagolnaiya in Feni, Gojariya, Talbariya and Doulatpur.

title: Gojariya Chara
content: Several streams came out from Ramporbari, Gojaliya and Nidonshinghobari of Tripura took the name after joining Eachother.

title: Honcho River
content: This river is called ‘Rigrikhyang’ in local language of Bandarban. Peoples of hill tracts call it “Sangu” too. It flows from the mountainous area that divides Arakan Mountains from Chittagong hill tracts. It fall into Bay of Bengal from the southern side of Karnafuli River.

title: Horai River
content: The river started from the Padma River in Rajbari district and ended into the River Kumar of Faridpur district. The length of the river is 22km, width is 20m, depth is 2, and basin is 88 sq.km.

title: Hori River
content: This river originated from the Teka River in Ovoynogor, Jessore and ended in the Vodra river of Dumuriya, Khulna. The river entered Dumuriya after passing Monirampur and Keshobpur from Ovoynogor. A dead branch of the river ended in Beel Dakatiya after flowing eastward from Monirampur through Bajitpur and Kumarghata. It got mixed with the River Vairob in Boyalmari, which is situated in the east side of Ovoynogor, and ended in Mukteshwari River after flowing through Chalshiya. A part of the river went east ward and ended in the Hamkura River after passing Thukro and Amvita of the Dakatiya beel. Two of its branches joined together in Vairob, one of which came from Rajghat and other from Sikirhat. From here they ended in Shailomari River after passing through Damodor. The part of this river that flowed eastward fell into Shailomari River after passing Dakatiya Beel. The river joined with the River Vodra at Kashimpur. Another branch joined the River Hamkura in Modhugram after passing Duyakul. Another of its branches fell into Hamkura river after passing Tulna, Krishnanagar and Thukro and Amvita. The length of this river is 18 km and its width is 60m. Its depth is 5m and the area of its basin is 72 sq.km.

title: Horinghata River
content: The up tide part of the River Bolashwor is named as Horinghata. The combined part of the Rivers Vola and Bolashwor fell in the Bay of Bengal with the name Horinghata. It is situated in the district border of Bagerhat and Borguna.

title: Horihor River
content: This river started its journey from the River Mukteshwori in Jessore and ended in the River Vodra in Keshobpur after flowing through Monirampur. Its length is 52km, width is 15m, depth is 3m and river basin is 200 sq.km.

title: Holholiya River
content: This river originated from the west border areas of Mymensingh. A part of this river was situatd in the east of Jamuna and another in the west. The east part of the river is near to extinction due to the increase of flow in Jamuna River. The west part reached Sherpur after joining with Bengali river in Joragacha and passing through Sariyakandi, Bogura and Dhunot. Then it joined the Korotoya River near Khanpur.

title: Haora River
content: The river originated in Tripura and entered into Bangladesh by Akhaura, Brahmanbariya. It fell into the River Titas in this district. Its length is 15 km, width is 40km, depth is 3.5m and its basin is 70 sq.km.

title: Hanu River
content: The river originated from Chakdoho beel in Sripur and ended in Nobogonga River in Magura district. The river is of 22 km in length, 20m in width, 4.5 m in depth and its basin is of 80 sq.km.

title: Haporkhali River
content: The river started its journey from the Gangrail River situated at Paikgacha, Khulna and Shirsa River of this district. The length of this river is 8.5km, width is 300m, depth is 14m and its basin is 32 sq.km.

title: Habra River
content: It originated from Sapmara-Shalkhali Khaal in Debhata, Satkhira and ended in the River Khelpetuya at Shyamnogor. The length of this river is 36km, width is 80m, depth is 3m and its basin is 100 sq.km.

title: Harta River
content: The river originated from Bisharkandi River in Ujirpur, Barishal. It fell into the u-turn of Ujirpur River and Shondha River after flowing 7 km eastward from the borders of Banaripara and Ujirpur.

title: Harthar River
content: It originated from the Kopotakkho River of Koloroya-Monirampur. It ended in the Chengrail River situated in the south-east of Mongolkot Union after passing Trimohini Union of Keshobpur and flowing by the side of Ghuhar Baor.

title: Harbang Chori
content: It originated from the hilly stream of Lamar in Bandarban and fell into the River Matamuhuri in Chokoriya. Its length is 28km, width 60km, depth 3m and basin is 150 sq.km.

title: Haraboti River
content: This branch river fell into the river Tulsiganga situated by the side of Bot-Toli Bridge in Shirottihat after flowing through Mohammadpur and Kushumba Union of Pachbibi in Jaypurhat.

title: Hariya River
content: It originated from the Salta River in Paikgacha, Khulna and ended in the river Shibsa of this district. It is 14 km in length, 50 m in width, 7.5 m in depth and its basin is 50 sq.km.

title: Haridoha or Haridhoya River
content: The river originated from the Lakkha or Shitolokka River at Shibpur in Noroshindi and ended in the Meghna River. It is 20 km in length, 100 m in width, 5 m in depth and its basin is 100 sq.km.

title: Hariyavanga River
content: It originated from the Hugli River of West-Bengal and flows in the borders of Bangladesh and India after passing through Uttor Chobbish Porgona. A branch from the river Raymongol also joined this river. It is also named as Horinvanga.

title: Halda River
content: The river originated from the Badnatoli Mountain at Fotikchori in Khagrachori. It fell into the Kornofuli River in Raujan after going through Hathajari, Chandgao in Chittagong. The river is of 105 km in length, 150m in width, 8 m in depth and its basin is of 815 sq.km.

title: Hijla River
content: It is situated in the north of Barisal city. Its length is 24km.

title: Hijli River
content: It originated from the Gur river in Singra, Pabna. It ended in the Gurnai River in Lakkhipur after flowing by the side of Hijli village and going through Bijoynagor, Krishnapur. Its length is 4km.

title: Hira River
content: The river came from North of Dhamrai and joined Gajikhali River and Bongshi River in Shingair.

title: Hurashagor River
content: The river originated at Baiotora in Sirajgonj and ended in the Padma River at Bera in Pabna. It passes Belkuchi, Ullapara, Shahajadpur in its route. It is 66 km in length, 60 m in width, 7 m in depth and its basin is 300 sq.km.

title: Herachamti River
content: It started from the River Chatol at Dirai in Sunamganj and ended in the river Kamarkhali in the same sub-district. It is 15 km in length, 40 m in width, 6.5 m in depth and its basin is 30 sq.km.

title: Hamkura River
content: This river originated from the beel Dakatiya at Dumuriya in Khulna and fell into the river Vodra. The part of Beel Dakatiya fro, Ramkrishnopur to the south of Baghmara is known as Hamkura River. The river is 15 km in length, 100 m in width, 0.50 m in depth and its basin is 45 sq.km.

title: Hoja River
content: This river originated from the river Musakhan. So it is also known as Musakhan River. It passed Chatni after entering Agdigha and Chondokola of Nator. It is divided into two parts near Harigacha. One branch ended in the river Baronoi at Piprul in the North of Basudebpur. Another ended in Guddu-Gomani river system with the name Godai after passing Amhati and Dighapatiya villages. Its length is about 15 km.

title: Hishi River
content: This small river takes off from Little Padma at Veramara, Kustia and ends at Mojslispur.

title: Hishni River
content: It originates from Padma river at Daulutpur upazila of Kustia district and then also falls into Padma river at Veramara upazila.

title: Harnath River
content: it originates at the three upazila boundary of Dumuria, Keshobpur and Tala that ends at Kolaroa.

title: Harta River
content: It originates at Ujirpur upazila and ends by meets with Ujirpur river.

title: Hongshoraj River
content: It has two source regions. One is at Khulna district and another at Shatkhira district.

title: Halta River
content: Mothbaria upazila of Pirojpur district is the emerged area of this river that’s fall at Boleshor river.

title: Hariavanga River
content: It has a boundary within Bangladesh (shamnagar, Shatkhira) and India.

title: Hatitana River
content: The Northern part of Chitramari that in Khulna district is the source region of this river and then meets with Salta river at Hatolbunia.

title: Hai River
content: It started flowing from border of Basail and Kalihati Upazilla of Tangail and then divided into two branches. One fall into Bangshi River and other into Langli River at Kaoualjani.

title: Hurul River
content: It started flowing from several streams at Gokorno and Maslanderpur of Nasirnagar Upazilla of Brahmanbaria and joined with Titas River at the north side of Dulaijuri.

title: Humu River
content: It started flowing from Kalni River at Dirai Upazilla of Sunamganj and fall into Kalni at Durgapur.

title: Hira River
content: It connects Gazikhali River with Bongshi River at east Dhamrai of Dhaka.

title: Haora River
content: It started from Tripura and entered into Bangladesh and flowed to the East of Comillaand joined the River Titash in the south of Akhaura after passing Gangashagor.

title: Hatheri River
content: This river comes out from South side of Chandanbari (Boda Upazilla, Panchagarh) that meets with Pathoraj rivr at North side of Kalikagaon Hat.

title: Hira River
content: This river derived from Shyampur of Manda Upazilla, Naogaon that divided near Kumar Pur; among them one meets with Atrai river other meets with Barnai river.

title: Haraboti River
content: This river has many tributaries which found in Dinajpur district that discharged in Tulshi Ganges river at Binodpur Telabadai.

title: Hallai River
content: This river derived from Shahjadpur and Chapabari of Birganj Upazilla, Rangpur that joined with Akhira river at North side of Raypur.

title: Halhalia River
content: This river comes out from Western edge of Mymensingh Upazilla that joined with Korotoya river through Banglai river at Khanpur, Sherpur.

title: Hijli River
content: This river derived from Pachpir of Ulipur Upazilla, Kurigram that falls into Dharla river at Shampur.

title: Helencha River
content: This river derived from Narda at Parkholiyabari of Nator Sadar that fallen again into Narad at Dharail.

title: Haragila River
content: Generated from Jamuna river between Buhar Dhalai and Khash Dhalai of Chouhali Upazilla, Sirajganj that again discharged in Jamuna through Char Penchkola.

title: Hujrapur Khari River
content: This river coming out from Purnavaba at Rahanpur which divided into two tributaries after travels few distance.

title: Haravanga Khari
content: Ousted between Soal Danga and Khalshi Danga of Porsha Upazilla that meets with one tributary of Purnavaba at Goyala.

title: Haowa
content: Haowa gang starts from the Baluabil and ends at the Chatal bil.

title: Huriyajan
content: Huriyajan river starts from Sagiya and ends at the Shwameshwari river.

title: Hurma
content: Hurma gang starts from the Surma river and ends at the Harokhal.

title: Harimangal
content: Harimangal river starts from the Border of Chandrapur and one stream ends at the Ghunghur river, another stream ends at Gopalnagar.

title: Hingrajani River
content: It started from Dapuniya in Mymenshingh and reached the border of Trishal after passing Nageshwari River in its way.

title: Ham Hamla River, Dorsha Gang River and Gangina River
title_bn: হাম হামলা নদী, দোরসা গাং নদী ও গাঙ্গিনা নদী
content: The water flow that originated from the Garo hill track in India that reached Dorsha Gang in the north of Haluya Ghat was named Ham Hamla River and it got mixed with Gangina River after passing Kismot Norail.

title: Heolo River
content: It’s a mountain originated border river that flows by the side of Tripura and pass Bakhaitola, Randhunikura and Ghoshbar before ending in Dorsha Gang.

title: Ihorbaria River
content: The river emerges from Shamnagar upazila of Shatkhira district that ends at Atlia by meeting with Khepuparia river.

title: Ibri River
content: This river emerges from Jamuna river at Shamnagar upazila of Shatkhira district that ends at Munshiganj by meeting with Dumkhali canal.

title: Isabah Gang
content: It started flowing from Makadul Beel of Jaintapur and Kanaighat Upazilla and fall into Lain River.

title: Ilishmari River
content: It started flowing from Padma River of Dhaka and falls into Ichamati.

title: Ilangluri River
content:
It started from chunai beel at the border of Nettrokona and sunamgonj and flows until
Kuri gao after passing goiria beel.

title: Iramoti River
content: Three streams come out from Pukur gacha, Khagra and Raghubongshipur (Adamdeghi Upazilla, Rangpur); among them first two meets at south side of Amsotta and Agunbazar and second meets with third near Amsotta and taken name as Iramoti which joined with Raktadaho Beel at Pabail.

title: Ichamati–Kalindi
content: Ichamati-Kalindi river starts from the Mathabhanga river (West Bengal) and ends at the bay of Bengal. It covers Satkhira sadar, Debhata, Kaliganj, Shamnagar. The total length of the river is 75 km. It’s a transboundary river.

title: Ichamati
content: Ichamati river starts from the Jamuna river and ends at the Padma river. It covers Gheor-Shibalay-Nababganj-Dohar,Manikganj district; Shirajdikhan-Shrinagar-Louhajang,Munshiganj district. The total length of the river is 90 km.

title: Ichamati
content: Ichamati river starts from the Padma river and ends at the Kalindi river. It covers Bheramara of Kushtia and Chuadanga. It’s a transboundary river

title: Ichamati
content: Ichamati river starts from the Padma river and ends at the Hurasagar river. It covers Ekdant, Ataikula, Bhulbaria, Sathiya, Bera of Pabna district. The total length of the river is 75 km. It’s a historical river.

title: Ichamati
content: Ichamati river starts from Ghuramara and ends at Gabtali upazila. It covers Gobinganj of Gaibandha, gabtali of Bagura. The total length of the river is 56.60 km.

title: Ichamati
content: Ichamati river starts from the Jamuna river and ends at the Karatoya river. It covers Supgacha, Pangasi, Brahmagacha, Bagbati of Sirajganj.

title: Ichamati
content: Ichamati river locally known as Tulsiganga river. It starts from the Chatian naga bil and ends at the Jamuna river. It covers Khansama, Chiri Bandar, Parbatipur, Fulbari of Dinajpur. The total length of the river is 82 km.

title: Ichamati
content: Ichamati river starts from the conjunction of several streams of Thandachari hill and ends at the Karnaphuli river. It covers Chittagong district. The total length of the river is 34 km. It has religious history.

title: Ilsha
content: Ichamati river starts from the Meghna river and ends at the Tentulia river. It covers Bhola district.

title: Irachamti
content: Irachamti river starts from the North of Kathaliya and ends at Ray Bangali.

title: Jhajha River
content: It originates from the upazila boundary line of Mirpur and Daulatpur that inKustia district.

title: Jamuna river
content: The river emerges from Kakshiali river at Kaliganj upazila of Shatkhira district and ends by meeting with Mothergang river at Manikpur  upazila at the same district.

title: Jaini River
