content: This river has been originated from the boundary line of Muladi and Hijli upazila of Barisal district and flows toward lower Meghna river at Harinathpur.

title: Jongolia RIver
content: It takes off from upazila boundary line of Pajapur and Nalshothi, Jhalkathi and ends at kathalia upazila.

title: Joyontia River
content: It emerges from Damudda upazila of Shariatpur district and then flows through different tributaries. Then it enters into Gshairat boundary.

title: Jongolia River
content: It originates from Bishkhali river at the meeting point of 5 upazila naming Rajapur, Betagi, Bakerganj, North Chitki and Nolishiti. It follows upto Bamonkhal.

title: Joykhali River
content: Kodomtoli of Khulna district is the origin area of this river from Ghangrel river and then also falls into this river at Shudhakhali.

title: Jaliar vangari River
content: Sharsa upazila of Jessore district is the source area of this river that divides into three estuary at Samlagachi. Then it meets with Betna river.

title: Jugikhali River
content: The sadar upazila of Khulna district is the origin place of this river and then falls into Gaokhali low-land at Bollovpur.

title: Jorakhali River
content: It started flowing from Gopalpur Haor of Chatak Upazilla and fall into Dorakhal Beel.

title: Jirjira River
content: It started flowing from border of Bakshiganj and Dewanganj Upazilla of Jamalpur and fall into Doshani River.

title: Jirag River
content: It started flowing from Joralbanga Beel of Sunamganj and flows up to Sachna Upazilla.

title: Janjuri River
content: It started flowing from south-eastern side of Paraya Beel of Balaganj Upazilla of Sylhet and falls into Kushiara River.

title: Jitai River
content: This river is situated at mawa union of gouripur, Mymensingh and Mahishhati Bazar at netrokona

title: Jiyakhara River
content: It started from Dhola beel and Hugli Beel in Khaliyajuri, Netrokona and joined Boyai Beel and Hata Beel after passing Jiyakhara Bazar.

title: July River
content: This river gets out between Nabiganj and Sindurnar of Pirganj Upazilla, Dinajpur that meets with Kahalai river at Harshua Bazar.

title: Jalchira River – Halholia River
content: This river generated from Brahmaputra river at Deghir Char, Kurigram District. Which stream flowing up to South side of Mojai, known as Jalchira river and from here which stream joined with Sonavari river, recognized as Halholia river.

title: Joyarkhali River
content: Which stream flows between Beelpaukola (Godagari Upazilla) and Paba Upazilla of Rajshahi District known as Joyarkhali river.

title: Jolka River
content: Which takes off from Chiknai river which created a link between Gabjia Beel, Gombeel, Chatorbell etc. and again falls into same river at Atgharia Upazilla, Pabna.

title: Jaludaha River
content: Streams ousted from Sarutia Mouja of Ullapara Upazilla, Sirajganj, divide into two streams near Morpara, Rakhaingacha. Between them one travels Falia, Ghiyala, Putia, Baman Ghiyala, Choubalia, Telkupi, South Para, Vormohani, Dhubli to Memanshahi. Another falls into Ichamoti and Korotoya rivers.

title: Jaliya Gang
content: Jaliya gang starts from Betauka and ends at the Lombabil.

title: Jhinuk River
content: Jhinuk river starts from Sithi and ends at the Baulai river.

title: Janaikhali River
content: Janaikhali river starts from the Panda river and ends at the Husainagar bil.

title: Jariya River
content: Jariya river starts from Guzalikanda & Tutirpara and ends at Dekanda.

title: Jamati Gang
content: Jamati gang starts from the Haludiya & Magura bil and ends at Jamati.

title: Jurkata River
content: Jurkata river starts from the Char Belgachi and ends at Imampur.

title: Jadukata River
content: Jadukata River is originated from the Meghalaya Hills of India & flows into Bangladesh via Shunamganj. The river is very wide in the rainy season. If you visit in the winter, the mile long sandy bank will tell you about the fierceness of the river at rainy season.

title: Koca River
content: Koca river starts from the estuary of Kaukhali, Kaliganga rivers and ends at the Baleshwar river. It covers Parerhat Steamer station-Gazir char,Barisal. The total length of the river is 35 km.

title: Karnaphuli River
content: Karnaphuli river starts from the north eastern border of Chittagong hill tracts and ends at the Bay of Bengal. It covers Chittagong hill tracts, Chittagong. The total length of the river is 274 km. It’s originated from the Lusai hill, India.

title: Kantinala River
content: Kantinala river starts from the Juri river and ends at the Hakaluki haor. It covers Kulaura upazila,Moulvibazar. The total length of the river is 25 km.

title: Kopotakkha river
content: Kopotakkha river starts from the Shibsa river and ends at the Khulpatuya river. It covers Khulna, Jessore, Satkhira districrs, Sundarban. The total length of the river is 180 km.

title: Komla River
content: Komla river starts from the Padma river and ends at Diargiria village. It covers Natore, Pabna districts. The total length of the river is 10 km.

title: Karatoya River
content: Karatoya river starts from the conjunction of several streams in Rangpur and ends at the Ichamati river. It covers Dinajpur, Rangpur, Bagura districts. Some portion of its course is called as Old Tista river. The total length of the river is 597 km. It’s the most important river for the North-Bengal. It has both historical and religious importance.

title: Karatoya River
content: Karatoya river starts from the Lowland of Syedpur, Nilphamari and ends at the Bangali river. It covers Parbatipur, Nabaganj, Badarganj, Gobindaganj, Shibganj, Bagura sadar upazilas. The total length of the river is 200 km.

title: Karatoya River
content: Karatoya river starts from Tentulia upazila and ends at the Atrai river. It covers Tentulia, Panchagarh sadar, Khansama, Boda, Debiganj upazilas. The total length of the river is 60 km. It’s a transboundary river, originated from West Bengal, India.

title: Karangi River
content: Karangi river starts from the hills of Bahubal upazila and ends at the Khuai river. It covers Bahubal, Habiganj sadar upazilas. The total length of the river is 50 km. It’s a transboundary river. This river was named after the name of Elephant (other name- Karangi).

title: Kahua River
content: Kahua river starts from the Muhuri river and ends again at the Muhuri river. It covers Parshuram-Fulgazi upazilas,Feni. The total length of the river is 17 km.

title: Koyra River
content: Koyra river starts from the Karatoya river and ends at the Hurasagar river. It covers Koyra upazila,Khulna. The total length of the river is 20.5 km.

title: Koyra River
content: Koyra river covers Narshingdi. Most probably in ancient period it used to meet with the Brahmaputra river.

title: Kakshiali River
content:
Kakshiali river starts from the Ichamati river and ends at the Habra river. It covers Kaliganj upazila,Satkhira.
The total length of the river is 20 km.

title: Kakra River
content: Kakra river starts from the Atrai river and ends again at the Atrai river. It covers Dinajpur district. The total length of the river is 25 km.

title: Kakri River(কাঁকড়ি নদী)
content: Kakri river starts from Chouddagram upazila and ends at the Feni river. It covers Chouddagram upazila,Comilla. The total length of the river is 12 km. It’s a transboundary river.

title: Kageshwari River
content: Kageshwari river starts from the Chiknai river and ends at the Jamuna river. It covers Sathiya upazila-Bera upazila,Pabna. The total length of the river is 22 km.

title: Kachamathia River
content: Kachamathia river starts from the Sohagi-Sarisha bil and nearby lowlands and ends at the Old Brahmaputra river. It covers Ishwarganj upazila-Nandail upazila,Mymensingh. The total length of the river is 46.75 km.

title: Kajal River
content: Kajal river starts from the Tentulia river and ends at the Ramnabad river. It covers Bauphal upazila-Kolapara upazila,Patuakhali. The total length of the river is 40 km.

title: Kazibacha River
content: Kazibacha river starts from the Rupsa river and ends at the Chunkuri river. It covers Batiaghata upazila-Dakup upazila,Khulna. The total length of the river is 32 km.

title: Katakhali River
content: Katakhali river starts from the Karatoya river and ends at the Bangali river. It Gobindganj upazila-Saghata upazila,Gaibandha. The total length of the river is 28 km.

title: Kata Jamuna River
content: Kata Jamuna river starts from the Jamuna river and ends at the Tulsi river. It covers the eastern side of Jamun river and Akkelpur. The total length of the river is 15 km.

title: Kaptai
content: Kaptai lake covers Rangamati, Khagracchari. The total length of the river is 145 km. It’s an artificial lake, which was completed in 1960.

title: Kamarkhal River
content: Kamarkhal river starts from the Chatal river and ends at the Kalni river. It covers Jagannatpur upazila-Derai upazila,Sunamganj. The total length of the river is 35 km.

title: Kalni River
content: Kalni river starts from the conjunction of Old Brahmaputra and Kushiyara rivers and ends at the Upper Meghna river. It covers Ajmeriganj uapzila,Habiganj; Itna-Mithamain-Asthagram,Kishoreganj district. The total length of the river is 82 km.

title: Kalni River
content: Kalni river starts by the conjunction of several branches of the Surma river in Lower Surma Valley and ends at the Padma river. It covers Bhairab, Chandpur district.

title: Kala River
content: Kala river starts from the Ghirnai-Karatoya river and ends again at the Ghirnai-Karatoya river. It covers Parbatipur upazila-Nabaganj upazila,Dinajpur. The total length of the river is 47 km.

title: Kaliganga River
content: Kaliganga starts from the Dhaleshwari river and ends again at the Dhaleshwari river. It covers Saturia upazila-Singair upazila,Manikganj. The total length of the river is 35 km.

title: Kaliganga River
content: Kaliganga starts from the Madhumati river and ends at the Koca river. It covers Nazirpur, Kaukhali, Pirojpur sadar upazilas. The total length of the river is 35 km.

title: Kalindi–Jamuna River
content: Kalindi-Jamuna river locally known as Ichamati-Kalindi-Raymangal. It starts from Satkhira sadar upazila and ends at the Raymangal river. It covers Debhata, Kaliganj, Shamnagar pazilas. The total length of the river is 75 km. It’s a transboundary river and originated from the West Bengal.

title: Kasti River
content: Kasti river starts from the Sonai river and ends at the Longon Balbhadra river. It covers Madhabpur upazila,Habiganj; Nasirnagar upazila,Brahmanbaria. The total length of the river is 34 km.

title: Kirtankhola River
content: Kirtankhola river locally known as Barisal river. It starts from Shayestabad and ends at the Gozalia river. It covers Barisal district. The total length of the river is 16 km.

title: Kirtinasha River
content: Kirtinasha river starts from the Padma river and ends at the Arial khan river. It covers Shariatpur sadar, Kalkini upazila,Madaripur. The total length of the river is 40 km. It’s a historical river.

title: Kobai River
content: Kobai river locally known as Agunmukha (some portion). It starts from Patuakhali and ends at the Ramnabad river. It covers Bakerganj of Patuakhali. The total length of the river is 97 km.

title: Karhardaria River
content: Kahardaria starts from the tangi river. It covers Tangi city.

title: Kawna River
content: Kawna river starts from the Brahmaputra river and ends at the Dhanu river. It covers Hussainpur.

title: Kakiyan River
content: Kakiyan river ends at the Hurasagar river. It Shahjadpur of Sirajganj.

title: Kakeshwar River
content: Kakeshwar river starts from the Ichamati river and ends at the Safulla khal. It covers Afra-Gopinathpur of Pabna.

title: Kajla River
content: Kajla river starts from the Padma river and ends at one of the khal of Chitra river. It covers Magura district and Hussainpur, Bamanhat, Peduli, Tularampur, Mulia, Harikhali of Narail.

title: Katakhali River
content: Katakhali river starts from the conjunction of Shisa and Kopotakkha. It covers Khulna, Satkhira.

title: Karkhuma River
content: Karkhumai river locally known as Karkhana river. It starts from the Tentulia river and ends at the Nohaliya river. It covers Patukhali.

title: Kalabadar River(কালাবদর নদী)
content: Kalabadar river starts from the Ilsha river. It covers Bhola.

title: Kalijira River
content: Kalijira river starts from the Sugandha river. It covers Barisal

title: Kaliganga River
content: Kaliganga river starts from the Gorai river and ends at the Kumar river. It covers Jhenaidah. The total length of the river is 50 km. This river is now almost dead due to extreme urbanization.

title: Kaliganga River
content: Kaliganga river used to cover Magura, Narail. It is an extinct river now. It had historical background.

title: Kalumalu River(কালুমালু নদী)
content: Kalumalu river locally known as Ata khal. It is an artificial river, which was dug during Sultani period.

title: Kasalang River
content: Kasalang river starts from Baghaichari and ends at the Karnaphuli river. It covers Rangamati. The total length of the river is 65 km.

title: Kukuya River
content: Kukuya river starts from Patuakhali and ends at the Burishwar river. It covers Patuakhali, Barguna. It’s a transboundary river

title: Kutubdia Channel
content: Kutubdia channel is a river valley. It starts from the Kutubdia island and both sides are connected to the Bay of Bengal.  The total length of the river is 24 km.

title: Kumar Upper River(কুমার আপার নদ)
content: Kumar Upper River starts from the Arial khan river and ends at the Bil Rut river. It covers Madaripur, Gopalganj. The total length of the river is 40 km.

title: Kumar River
content: Kumar River locally known as Kalobil. It starts from the Mathabhanga river and ends at the Nabaganga river. It covers Alamdanga of Chuadanda, Magura. The total length of the river is 144 km.

title: Khana Gang
content: Khana gang starts from the Radhanagar bil and ends at the Tattakhali khal.

title: Kunj Gang
content: Kunj gang starts from the Bibiyana river and ends at the Itakhola river.

title: Khuratta Gang
content: Khuratta gang starts from the Bibiyana river and ends at the Kushiyara river. It’s another course strats from Bagdura and ends at the Boro bil.

title: Kushiya River
content: Kushiya river starts from the East of Atgaon and ends at the Surma river.

title: Khajanchi River
content: Khajanchi river starts from the Surma river and ends at the West-North of Chauk. It’s second course starts from Bhatpara and ends at the Khajula river & Agaripur khal. It’s third course starts from Dekbanga and ends at the Suyo river.

title: Khajula River
content: Khajula river starts from Pushni and ends at Bhagimatipur.

title: Khajala River
content: Khajala river starts from the Khajanchi river and ends at the South o Pal Chauk.

title: Kajua Gang
content: Kajua gang starts from the lowland of Khalpara and ends at the Chamti river.

title: Kuchandhara River
content: Kuchandhara river starts through Lakshmikura & Rangjura and ends at the Shibdara bil.

title: Kalatiya River
content: Kalatiya river starts through the Kathaliyar char & Shareshwati char and ends at the Meghna river.

title: Khaiya River
content: Khaiya river starts from the Khamgaon bil and ends at the Shari/Hari river.

title: Khepa Gang
content: Khepa gang starts from the Jaintapur and ends at the Khaiya river.

title: Kota Gang
content: Kota gang starts from the Kalni river and ends at the Nilaji gang.

title: Kalakhal
content: Kalakhal starts from West Noadda  and ends at West Joshpur.

title: Koilo Mogra River
content: Koilo Mogra river starts from Khalishjan and one stream ends at Kashimpur, another stream ends at Mochra & Kagchar.

title: Kulkail River
content: Kulkail river starts from Lakhai and ends at the Dhaleshwari river.

title: Kurma River
content: Kurma chara starts from Kurma tea garden and ends at the Dhalai river.

title: Kansa River
content: Kansa river starts from Mohanganj and ends at Jamalganj.

title: Kareya River
content: Kareya river starts from the Kewna bil and ends at the Palki river.

title: Kurikhai River
content: Kurikhai gang starts from Bhuna and ends at Chariakona & Daricharia kona.

title: Kudalkati River
content: Kudalkati river starts from Hapania & Siddhirchar and ends at the east side of Guchamara.

title: Khiro River
content: Khiro river starts from Kolnajani and one stream ends at the Akhila river, another stream ends at Boundary of Golavita.

title: Kanglakhai River
content: Kanglakhai river starts from the Kumrabil & Daina bil and ends at the Gopla river.

title: Kolomdari River
content: Kolomdari river starts from the Kanchibara bil and ends at Kalna jani.

title: Kumar Kuira River
content: Kumar kuira river starts from the Kolashpar & Paikola bil and ends at the Malijhi river.

title: Khaura River
content: Kahura river starts from Meshkura and ends at the Thalong river.

title: Kalimogra River
content: Kalimogra river starts from Bonadipara and ends at Sonai river.

title: Kaksiriya River
content: Kaksiriya river starts from the Mogra river and first stream ends at the South of Chariya, second stream ends at the Galiyabil.

title: Kolihar River
content: Kolihar river starts from the Kolihar bil & Sehala and ends at Sutrapara.

title: Kudaliya River
content: Kudaliya river starts from Rubber garden near Srimangal and ends at the Hail haor.

title: Kamarkhali River
content: Kamarkhali river starts from Ray Bangali and ends at Toral & Rampur.

title: Kulipati River
content: Kulipati river starts from Hussain nagar and ends at the Nanda bil.

title: Khalaliya River
content: Khalaliya river starts from Sadarpur & Shimultola and ends at the Khajanchi river.

title: Kota dara River
content: This river generated from Dead Padma river that falls into Padma river through Harma to Charuisha (Chapai Nawabganj District.

title: Kuchiyamuri River
content: This river comes from Barabeel at Pirganj Upazilla, Rangpur, that meets with Akhira river at Dhaperhat.

title: Kolsardar River
content: This river derived from Goyali Beel at Pirganj Upazilla that comes up to Hasan Para

title: Kathgara River
content: This river ousted between Bauchandi and Gopalpur of Dinajpur Districtthat fallen into Jamuneshwari river at North Baluya – Masumpur.

title: Kaliani River
content: This is the border river of Kuchbihar and Kurigram District that enter Bangladesh after penetrate the north – east boundary of Salsha and meets with Godadhar or Tharna river.

title: Kanchan River
content: Comes out from Malhajar of Dinajpur Sadar Upazilla that meets with Purnavaba river.

title: Kalia River
content: This river outs from Kuchbihar, India that enters Bangladesh between North – West boundary of Salamara and patching up with Gadadhara river at south – east Dhalavanga through Vurungamari Upazilla, Kurigram.

title: Kaluya River
content: This river genesis from Dharla river at Madajalpara of Lalmonirhat District that dischared into Dena Beel and Dharla river.

title: Kulihala River
content: Which streams comes out from Krishnapur of Kalmakanda Upazilla, Netrokona and meets with Goneshwar river and After that this confluence stream discharged into Mahadeo river at Omargaon, known as Kulihala River.

title: Kochua River
content: This river ousted from North – West Purba Pathoir of Kachua Upazilla, Chandpur that divided near Kachua; after that one streams flows up to the border of Chandina and others up to Hajigaj border.

title: Kaonal River
content: This river derived from Noldugi Beel at Barhatta Upazilla, Netrokona that divided at Chenjon Beel.

title: Kasti River
content: This river comes out from Sonai river at Madhabpur Upazilla, habiganj that fallen into Longan Balvadro river near Nasirnagar.

title: Kalai River
content: This river originated from Geora Beel at Mithamoin Upazilla, Kishoreganj that created a circular route after divided into various tributaries at Ajmiriganj Border.

title: Kolpo/ Pabni River
content: It is the sub – tributary of Rani river that ousted from Atrai river near Kathanongla that joined with Barnai river.

title: Kumlai River
content: This river coming out from Chatnai Beel of Nilphamari district that end up to Baroshiya, Muslim Para.

title: Khamar Chatnai River
content: This river derived from Swamps Land that found between Gajabari and Kamalbonda of Nilphamari District, coming up to Daripattoni, Khamar Chatnai.

title: Khukshi River
content: This is the border river that generated from Rangu river at Kashiyabari (Mekliganj Thana, Jalpaigri District, India), travelling through Balurghat, it crossed Bangladesh from Dhamrai Hat Upazilla of Naogaon District and meets with Chota Jamuna at Mathurapr.

title: Kheruya River
content: This river comes out from Ketkibari Swamps of Domar Upazilla, Nilphamari, that meets with Deonai river at Naodabag.

title: Konai River
content: This river takes off from Jamuna river at Deghalkandi, Saghat Upazilla, Gaibandha and patch up with Bangali river at Gobindopur.

title: Kalamdar River
content: Ousted between Khanabari and Horihor of domar Upazilla, Nilphamari and ends at Jaldhaka.

title: Kahalai River
content: This river ousted from Hajirpur, Hat Singa of Pirganj, Thakurgaon, that enters India through Upadail.

title: Kakon River
content: This river comes out from North Narna of Shahjadpur Upazilla, Sirajganj that falls into Baral river at Pojana.

title: Khari River
content: This river coming out from Dhamdhum and Chalkparuli of Tanor and Godagari Upazilla.

title: Khana River
content: This river takes off from North – East Beel of Balpara Hat, Hatibandha Upazilla, Lalmonirhat that travels up to Khamarsitai.

title: Kalakihara Rive
content: This river comes out from Kalakihar of Mohanganj Sadar Union, Rajibpur Upazilla, Kurigram and ends after advanced few distances.

title: Khattimara River
content: It is ousted from Beel area of Pakuri and Kharikhal of Kuchbihar State that enter Bangladesh through Hela Pakrir Hat and fallen into Sheniajan River near Vatpara.

title: Khora River
content: One stream which coming out from North side of Khamar Chatnai, Nilphamari, that crosses Bandipara, Naoapara, Barobisa and Muslim Para.

title: Kalapam River
content: This river out from Mandura of Shaghatta Upazilla, Gaibandha that divided into two branches at Bhagobanpur. Among them one ends up at Ghuriyadaho and others meets with Bangali river at Kumar Para.

title: Kharimaria / Khatimaria River
content: Derived from Kandapukur of Dinajpur Upazilla that flows up to South Para through Angur Para, Soniray, Arajai, Musrat, Kachupara, Chota Dupi Para and Talakboroihati.

title: Khayamara River
content: It started from South-Eastern side of Jalaldi beel of Sunamganj Sadar Upazilla and fall into Chatal Beel.

title: Kaldahar River
content: It started flowing from Dhanu River of Sunamganj district and fall into Pangna Beel flowing through Asmatpur, Sabipur, Syednagar and Bhutiapur.

title: Kaniakul River
content: It started flowing from Nilchul Beel of Sunamganj district and flows upto Kamipar Beel through Sahatipur and Denarbag.

title: Kulkulia Gang
content: It started flowing from Chilaura Beel of Habiganj and joined Bijna Gang near Kandigaon.

title: Kaliuri River
content: It started flowing from west side of Bagadair Beel of Goainghat, Sylhet and fall in two streams at Gangiajuri River and Paital Beel.

title: Kaat gang
content: It started flowing from Dheeraj Beel of Sunamganj and then divided into two branches at Badarkandi. One part flows upto East of Niyamatpur and the other flows upto Sonakandi.

title: Konai Gang
content: It started flowing from Chata Beel of Dharmapasha Upazilla of Sunamganj and flows upto Doulatpur through Ramnagar.

title: Kaonai River
content: It started flowing from Ambadi of Dharmapasha Upazilla of Sunamganj and flows upto Moktarpur.

title: Koai River
content: It started flowing from Borochor Beel, Jualia Beel and Koayil Beel and fall into Sutang River.

title: Kolkoilia Nala/Canal
content: It started flowing from Koyanja River of Lakhai Upazilla of Habiganj and flows upto Shantoshpur.

title: Khurma River
content: It started flowing from Sautola of Duilat Beel at Sunamganj and fall into Mardhala Beel.

title: Kadamdara River
content: It started flowing from Banar River of Fulbaria Upazilla and joined with Khiru River into Radhakanai and Ochimpatuli.

title: Khasud River
content: It started flowing from Mahadi Beel of Chatak Upazilla and flows upto Singcha.

title: Khana Gang
content: It started flowing from border of Bishwanath and Chatak and then divided into two branches. One flows upto Sotpur and the other upto border at west side.

title: Kachua River
content: It started flowing from west of Laukara at Hajiganj and Kochua Upazilla and then divided in two parts. One flows upto Shyondhorbopur and the other flows upto west border naming Dakatia River.

title: Kurcha River
content: It started flowing from Karabil of Monmoth of Sunamganj and fall into Surma at Puran labanchori.

title: Kapna River
content: It started flowing from border side of Goainghat and Kanaighat Upazilla of Sylhet and fall into Singar Khal at Ratargul.

title: Kalakuta River
content: It started flowing from south-western border side Beel of Dirai Upazilla and fall into Haranpur Beel.

title: Kagi River
content: It started flowing from several streams of Tripura of India and entered into Bangladesh through Godanagar and Choto Haripur and then fall into Pagli River.

title: Kachi Gang
content: It started flowing from Haor regions of Sunamganj Sadar Upazilla and fall into Borachai Beel.

title: Kanglakhali River
content: It started flowing from two streams of Farwada Beel and Kumrafilna Beel of Moulvibazar Sadar Upazilla and flows upto Angopola.

title: Kaithadi River
content: It started flowing from Meghna River of Dhaka and falls into Brahmaputra River.

title: Kachikata River
content: It started flowing from Meghna of Dhaka and fall into Kirtinasha River.

title: Kirtinasha River
content: It started flowing from Padma River of Dhaka and falls into the same river.

title: Kholi Gang
content: It started from kajura gang at Dirai , Sunamgonj and passed Gushahai beel and falls into Aalagakata beel.

title: Kalapani River
content: The river started from the shomeshshori river near joyoshri in dharampasha at Sunamgonj and ended in the same river in the middle of Chandpur and muktarpur.

title: Kaikhal River
content: It started from the kalai River and Moragona beel at mithamoyin Ajmirigonj in kishorgonj and flows until khatoal- ajmirigonj border.

title: Khaldiga River
content: It started from the Chakuya centre of the Piyain river at Khaliyajuri in Netrokona and flows forward keeping Faridpur at the west.

title: Kumar Kuira River
content: This river started from the Malijhi River in Sherpur and passed Kuruli Kanda, Bondhobaul, Bohidavanga, Kaoyapechi and Paikar beel before falling in the Malijhi river.

title: Karnatali River
content: The river that started from the Bangshi river near Savar and Shingair and ended in the Turag river near Aminbazar is known as Karnatali River.

title: Kakuriya River
content: It started from te Mogra River in Fulpur Mymensingh and headed toward East before falling again in the same river.

title: Kalihata River
content: It started from between Omorgao and Chinahol in Kolmakanda, Netrokona and flows through Kalihata, Boidyagao, boromoya until the border of Gurnibeel.

title: Kasta gang
content: It was  originated from mohammadpur, Sunamganj  nad fall at madhabpur with bibiyana river.

title: Kharia River
content: The river that takes off from Bathaghata of Khulna and ends at Khajurtola with Kazibacha river is known as Kharia river.

title: Kunga River
content: It is a Sundarban river that flows through a island and ends by meeting with Bay of Bengal.

title: Kolagachiya Done River
content: This river has been emerged from Golachipa upazila and ends at Jadua upazila.

title: Kahadone River
content: It originates from the Kalirchor estuary at Mothbaria upazila and then flows with differents distributary that ends by meeting with  Bunia canal

title: Kartikpur River
content: The boundary line of Noria and Vedorganj upazila is its source region that ends by meeting with Padma.

title: Kharaia River
content: Baithaghata upazila is the source region of this river and then ends at Bolbunia.

title: Kaga River
content: It originates from Kunga river and flows upto Sadia falls.

title: Kuchia River
content: Horikhola Chalk of Khulna district is the origin place for this river from Shibsa river and aslo falls this river again through Betbunia.

title: Kholiar River
content: It originates from the Bakerganj upazila that flows through Tumchar and Chaiamtakatr and at last meets with Arial khan river.

title: Khonaforia River
content: It emerges from Joykhali river at Tala upazila of Shatkhira district and ends by meeting with Joykhali river at Kazilhula.

title: Ketara River
content: It originates from Kalkini upazila of Shariatpur district and ends by meeting with Meghna river.

title: Kalabader River
content: Maskata river at Mehendiganj is the source area of this river that follows up to Arial Khan river  and falls into Nealganj river

title: Kumar River
content: It takes off from Padma river at Sadar Upazilla of Faridpur district. It follows through Gopalgonj district and meets with the haor area at Sindhiyaghat of Madaripur district. The length of it is 130 km with 80 meter of width.

title: Kumar Lower River
content: It originates from Arial Khan river at Sadar Upazilla of Madaripur district. The Lower Kumar River ends at Agoiljhora upazilla of Barisal district. The length of this river is 23 km along with 25 meter of width.

title: Kumilli River
content: It originates at Pabna distrit and flows aside the Hatti. Then, this river ends at Shahebganj by meeting with Phuljor River.

title: Kurum River
content: This river emerges from the hilly region of Jalpaiguri of India and enters into Bangladesh through Harivasha Upazila, Panchagarh. After flowing about 30 km in Bangladesh, then it falls int Karotoya River near Deviganj upazila of the same district.

title: Kurulia River
content: The Kurulia river has been originated from Titas River at Brahmanbaria Sadar Upazilla and ends also at the same upazilla along with same river. The length of it is only 4.5 km along with 7 meter of depth but 80 meter width.

title: Kulik River
content: The river Kulik originates near Thakurgaon district. It is a border river among Bangladesh and India. The length of this river is 30 km with 100 m width within Bangladesh.

title: Kurlia River
content: It takes off from Shibsha river at Pikegacha Upazilla of Khulna district and ends at Minhaz river at the same upazilla. Length of the river is 8 km along with width of 300 m.

title: Kushiara River
content: It has an Indo-Bangla border that originates at Assam state of India. It enters into Bangladesh through Jokigonj, Sylhet. It takes the rename as Kalni at Azmirigonj, Honigonj. It has a length of 229 km in Bangladesh. The average width is 157 meter.

title: Kociya River
content: Locally this river is known as Koidangar river in Pabna. It meets with Boral River at Faridpur Upazilla, Pabna.

title: Kodla River
content: This river originates at West Bengal, then enters into Bangladesh through Jhenaidah and again enters into India following only 10 km.

title: Khirai River
content: It is a tributary of ancient Dholesshori. It follws through Manikganj district and meets with Ichamati river.

title: Khorborabad River
content: It takes off from Koira, Barishal district to Soyetpara.

title: Kharkhariya River
content: This river originates from the Singimari haor region of Nilphamari district and then flows through Dinajpur District along about 75 km. it ends meeting with Jamuna river.

title: Khagdon River
content: The originating location of the river is 22’08’’N Latitude and 90’13’’ E longitude of this river. It ends with Bishkhali River in Broguna District.

title: Khapravanga River
content: This river originates at Patuakhali and also ends at the same district with flowing abot 18 km. Khapravanga river has all year round drainage availability with tidal effect.

title: Kharuvaj–Bullai River
content: This river originates from thelow-land area (locally known as bill) of Nilphamari district that flows about 45 km until ends with Jomunesshari River at Badarganj, Rangpur.

title: Khairabad River
content: It originates from Kritonkhola river at the district boundary of Jhalkathi and Barisal district and end meeting with Paira river at Bakerganj Barisal agter folloing about 40 km.

title: Khubji–Telkupi River
content: It is a seasonal river that originates from Gurr river at Jogendronagar. It is also known as Middle Atrai.

title: Khepa River
content: It is a tributary of Korotoya –Atrai river that takes off from Atrai river at Mohonpur, Dinajpur. After following about 40 km, it meets with Purnavaba River. For its nature ‘off the rails’, it is named Khepa River.

title: Kholpetua River
content: It is one of the biggest rivers of West Sundarban. It originates from the Betna river at Moheshpur upazilla, Jhenaidah. Locally it is known as Gang (river) at Budh-hata, Satkhira district. It ends after meeting with kopotakkho river and then the two confluences is known as Arpangshia River.

title: Khoai river
content: The Indo-Bangla borderline river, Khoai originates from hilly region Atharomura at Tripura state, India. It enters into Bangladesh through Chunarughat Upazilla, Hobiganjan and end at Lakhai upazilla metting with Kalni river after following about 94 km within Bangladesh.

title: Kulkuliya River
content: The river came from the west of Godainogor at Lakhai and Nasir and joined Borak River after passing Lakhai and Kamalpur of Habiganj district.

title: Kaikhal River
content: The river came out from Ajmiriganj and Mithamain of Habiganj and joined the Kalni River after passing Ghora beel.

title: Kulkuliya River
content: The river came from the west of Godainogor at Lakhai and Nasir and joined Borak River after passing Lakhai and Kamalpur of Habiganj district.

title: Longon-Balvadra River
content: This river originates from Bihura of India and fall into Rupsa river of Nasirnagar, Brahmanbaria. It flows through Madhabpur Upazilla of Habiganj and Nasirnagar of Brahmanbaria. Its length is 30 km and width 30 meters. Its depth is 5 meters. Longon-Balvadra covers 120 square km river basin area.

title: Longla River
content: It’s a border river. It originates from Tripura, India and fall into Kushiyara River at Moulvibazar Sadar. It flows through Sreemangal to Moulvibazar Sadar. Its length is 75 km and depth 7 meters. Its width varies, in Motiganj, its 80 meter. Its river basin area is 2100 square km.

title: Lota River
content: Lota River started from Meghna River at Dhormoganj of Mehendigonj Upazilla, Barisal. It fall into Arial Khan River at the same Upazilla. Its length is 20 km, width 600 meters and depth is 17 meters. It covers 80 square km river basin area.

title: Labangabati River
content: This river originates from Kholpetua river of Satkhira Sadar Upazilla. It fall into Ichamati River through Alipur Union, Bhomra Union, border area of Debhata-Satkhira Sadar and Kamarpur Union. Its length is 45 km, width 10 meters.

title: Labandaha River
content: It flows from Sreepur Upazilla of Gazipur to Mirzapur Union, border area of kaliakair and fall into swamp region of Konabari Union.

title: Lohor River
content: It originates from Tripura of India and fall into Titas River at Brahmanbaria Sadar. It’s a tributary of Titas River. Its length is 12 km, width 35 meters. Its depth is 4 meters.

title: Laogang River
content: It originates from Mohasing River of Sunamganj Sadar and fall into old Surma River. Its length is 8 km, width 75 meters and depth 6 meters. It covers 16 square km river basin area.

title: Lachchhi River
content: It started from Kachna Beel of Pirganj Upazilla, Thakurgaon and fall into Tangon River of same Upazilla. Its length is 12 km, width 10 meters and depth 2.5 meters. River basin area for Lachchhi River is 50 square km.

title: Lona River
content: It started flowing from Baliadangi Beel of Baliadangi Upazilla, Thakurgaon and fall into Nagor River at Haripur Upazilla. It flows through Baliadanga, Ranishonkoil and Haripur. Its length is 20 km, width 70 meters and depth 1.5 meters. It covers 60 square km river basin area.

title: Lohalia River
content: Starting from Tetulia river of Bauphal Upazilla, Patuakhali, this river fall at Patuakhali River at Kolapara Upazilla. It flows through Bauphal, Patuakhali Sadar, Golachipa and Kolapara Upazilla. Its length is 60 km, width 250 meters at Kayetpara and depth 8 meters. Its river basin area is 468 square km.

title: Louhajang River(লৌহজং নদী)
content: It started flowing from Dhaleshwari river of Tangail Sadar and flows through south-eastern way. It fall into Elongjani River at Delduar. This river’s length is 76 km, width 40 meters and depth 5 meters. Its river basin area is 104 square km.

title: Laredigha River
content: It started flowing from Piayin Beel of Sunamganj district and fall into Galia Kata Beel.

title: Lokhaizora River
content: It started flowing from Solahapara Beel of Dharmapasha Upazilla of Sunamganj and flows upto East of Banal Gang.

title: Langlia River
content: It started flowing from Lokra Beel of Habiganj and then joined with Boiragikhal.

title: Lonka River
content: It started flowing from Lankakandar of Mymensingh SadarUpazilla and fall into Telki Beel.

title: Laora River
content: It started flowing from Netrokona Sadar Upazilla and border of Purbadhola Upazilla and fall into Mogra River at Netrokona.

title: Ligang River
content: It started flowing from Shurja Beel of Sunamganj Sadar Upazilla and then flows upto Haripur through Jibdara.

title: Loraijani River
content: It started flowing from Narayanpur of Sunamganj Sadar Upazilla and then divided into two branches, one fall into Meghna Beel and another flows upto Battagaon.

title: Labandaha River
content: It started flowing from two different originating flows. One started from Madhupur forests of Tangail and fall into Turag River and the other flows through the border of Gazipur Sadar Upazilla and Sripur Upazilla.

title: Lohar River
content: It originated from the Tripura mountains and entered into Bangladesh through Mukundopur in Comilla and ended into the Titas River.

title: Lohagora River
content: This river originated from Gorachapa Beel at Sonatala Upazilla, Bogra and divide after crossing few distance near Velurpara Rail Station; among them one heads up to Digdair and other flows up to Gangni.

title: Lohagora River
content: This river originated from Gorachapa Beel at Sonatala Upazilla, Bogra and divide after crossing few distance near Velurpara Rail Station; among them one heads up to Digdair and other flows up to Gangni.

title: Larkhai
content: Larkhai river starts from Kumudganj-Ramnagar and ends at the Chamgaon bil.

title: Las
content: Las gang starts from Raysar & Balir bhag and ends at the Batidigha bil.

title: Lohachora
content: Lohachora river starts from the Kushiyara river and ends at Ariyamuga.

title: Lagata Chara
content: Lagata chara starts from the Cahidan chara, Waliyajipunji & Matirambari and ends at the Kewma bil.

title: Launi
content: Launi river starts from Mikni and first stream ends at Kiyapara bazar, second stream ends at the Rasulpur.

title: Labangaborti River
content: It originates from Ichamoti river of at Sadar upazila of Shatkhira district. Then it make joint with Khepupetia river at the boundary of Debhata.

title: Lain River
content: It’s a u-shaped river that flows through Jaintapur and Kanaighat in Sylhet.

title: Laghata River
content: The river passes through Komolgonj in Moulavibazar and it is famous for collecting fine sand.

title: Lakkha River
content: This river started from Tejgaon and passed Rupganj, Boralu Paragao, Chatiyan, Purbogao, Rupshi, Kumurghop, Noapara, Siddhirganj, Atonogor, Kochpur, Marna, Ajirpur and flowed until Lakkha and Kutubpur.

title: Lain River
content: It started from Jaintapur in Sylet and ended after reaching Dhupi.

title: Lova River
content: This river originated from the Khashiya mountain in India and moved through Mulagul Tea garden, Borgao, Saudgao, Potibeel, Sotipur, Meka and joined the Surma river at Lakkhipur.

title: Lengliya River
content: This river started from the Khoyai river at Hamar Char in Habiganj and ended in Monirampur Beel after passing Chunarughta-Banuachang road, Dhulakhal and Richi in its way.

title: Lalat/Lalti River
content: It started from the border of Valuka in Mymesingh and Ghotai in Tangail and ended in river Bajuya after crossing Ukhura, Dakatiya and Mallikbari.

title: Mohishala River
content: It originates from Mamkandi of Faridpur district and ends at Vataipara, Gopalganj district.

title: Muchikhali River
content: The river that takes off from Sadar Upazila of Magura and ends by meeting with Naboganga river is known as Muchikhali river.

title: Mashkata River
content: It takes off from Tentulia river at Mehendiganj upazila of Barisal district and ends at Jangalia.

title: Mora River
content: The Damurhuda upazila of Chuadanga district is its origin place which runs upto Gobindapur.

title: Moravadar Gang River
content: The upazila of Paikgacha, Khulna is the source region of this river and ends by meeting with Shibsa estuary.

title: Manik–khola River
content: Konkarer Ber is the source area of this river at Khulna district. This river ends at Nunuta.

title: Maichora River
content: This river takes off from Poshur river at Bagerhat district and also meets with same river at Kaniadubi.

title: Moynakata River
content: The northern side of Padma river at Madaripur district is the source area of this river that ends at Shibchar.

title: Marjata River
content: The southern part of Kuch Vadrasan of Khulna is the source region of this river that follows upto Rangabari.

title: Mordat River
content: The sibsa river at Shamnagar upazila is the source region of this river and meets with Poshur river .

title: Malancha River
content: It has a boundary within Bangladesh (shamnagar, Shatkhira) and India and then falls into Bay of Bengal through Opornagochia.

title: Mukuleshori River
content: Monirampur upazila of jessore district  is the source region of this river that ends by meeting with low land of Horidashkati.

title: Manik–khola River
content: Morolganj and Mongla upazila of Bagerhat district is the source area of this river and ends by meeting with Khashia khali.

title: Modrub  River
content: It originates from the Western part of sahabajpur chanel at Lalmohon upazila. The Car Nazimuddin is the finishing point of this river.

title: Moukhali River
content: It originates from Kapotakkho river at Shatkhira district and then flows through Komomlapur.

title: Moukhali Duania River
content: It emerges from Mongla river at Paikgacha upazila of Khulna district and meets with Vodra river at Kharali.

title: Moragangni River
content: Dorshona upazila of Chuadanga district is the source area of this river. It ends by falling into Ichamoti river

title: Mohesshori River
content: It originates from Gaidghati of chuadanga district that ends by meeting with Chitra river at Kalupara.

title: Muldeyin Gang
content: It started flowing from Larka Beel of Sunamganj district and flows upto Rahmatpur through Kasimpur and Nazimnagar.

title: Mora Mahasingha River
content: It started flowing from Bagdubi Beel of Mahasingha River at Dirai Upazilla of Sunamganj and flows upto Thakurbhog.

title: Makunda River
content: It started flowing from Satipara Beel of Bishwanath and Chatak Upazilla and ended upto the border.

title: Mahasingha River
content: It started flowing from Sabdaribil and Malini Beel of Doara Bazar Upazilla of Sunamganj and joined Puraton Surma River or Chatol River. This river flows all the yearlong.

title: Marjora River
content: It’s a mountainous stream. It originated from Tripura of India and entered into Bangladesh through west of Dhaka-Sylhet Rail line and flows upto Rasulpur.

title: Machuya River
content: It’s originated from the Noliadubi at Balagonj , Sylhet and flows through Nouyagao , Banai, Konarai until Lamapara.

title: Moheshkhali River
content: The river originated from the Garo hills in India and entered Bangladesh through Sunamgonj , past Moheshkhola and divided into two parts at kana gao farm.

title: Maluhi River
content: The river started from the border of halua ghat and phulpur in Mymensingh and flows through chitna , baish kahaniya , ramshona , laukhari , chadhar , poraputia , kottra kanda , was Divided into two parts into Maksha , one of which falls into the kongsho river and the other flows until Balichanga , shanchur and Mokamela.

title: Matikata River
content: It started from Bitipara in Gazipur and passed Barnal and Kushadiya and joined the Banar river.

title: Majora River
content: It started from Jaforganj in Debiddar, Comilla and its north part joined the Titas river.

title: Matara and Maricha River
content: This two rivers flows through the plainland of Comilla and joined with the river gomoti.

title: Mongolahati River
content: It started from Kishorganj and flows through Majhati and kodaliya of Pakundiya and broke into two parts near the west of Narandi.

title: Moruya River
content: This river flows through Kamarchak at Rajnagar in Moulvibazar.

title: Murtakhai river
content: It was originated from dahuka river, Sunamganj.

title: Morchi or Makcha River
content: This river takes off from Mashipur of Pirganj upazilla, Rangpur that fallen into Korotoya river at Jhapur.

title: Mahila River
content: This river ousted between Tharul and Shyampur of Ghoraghat Upazilla, Dinajpur that confluence with Korotoya at Hasanhor.

title: Madardah River
content: This river takes off from Harakar beel at Imampur (Islampur, Kurigram District) that travels up to Gobindapur.

title: Maldah River
content: This river ousted from North – South – West of Dhaoal of Jaldhaka Upazilla, Nilphamari that divide at Naodobash; among them one falls into Sitai Beel and others travels up to Kulaghat after travels many areas.

title: Mailia
content: This rive derived from West side of Kishoreganj (Pirganj Upazilla, Thakurgaon) that meets with Tangon river at Basudebpur (West Dinajpur).

title: Mirjamahmud River
content: This river ousted from Nondakuja of Gurudaspur Upazilla, Nator that falls into Nondakuja at Dudhgari Village.

title: Mogha River
content: Two streams derived from Rajibpur and Katlabeel of Iswarganj Upazilla that meets with each other after travel few distances and taken name as Mogha that flows parallel to the border of Nandail.

title: Messi River
content: This river has two source. Among them, one coming out from Eastern side of Hemkumari of Kuchbihar District and travels through up to Patgram. Another flow derived from Hemkumari of Patgram that that’s come up to Baghdokra, Ratanpur, and Patgram.

title: Mongkhali River
content: This river ousted from West side of Ghaghot, Kaliganj Hat, Gobindaganj Upazilla and divvide near Pabna Hat.

title: Murai
content: Mura Chora starts from Chitangbari and one stream ends through the international border of Sunamganj.

title: Murtakhai
content: Murtakhai river starts from Betabil Rokuntaz and ends at the Mahabil.

title: Magura
content: Magura river starts from the Pond of Durgapur and ends at the Itakhola river.

title: Matijora
content: Matijora river starts from Chandigaon & Gowalgaon and ends at Borotukar.

title: Makunda
content: Makunda river starts from the Singrail bil and ends at Narsingpur & Borotuka.

title: Marua
content: Marua river starts from the North-west of Bhatera hills and ends at the Kushiyara river.

title: Muni
content: Muni gang starts from the Kushiyara river and ends at the Botidigha bil.

title: Mora
content: Mora gang starts from the conjunction of Rampur-Neyamatpur area and ends at the South-west of Laluya char.

title: Mora Bhogai
content: Mora Bhogai river starts from Jaymangal and one stream ends at the Darsa river, again another stream ends at the Darsa river.

title: Manigal
content: Manigal river starts from Gadhunagar and ends at the Sutang river.

title: Mahari
content: Mahari river starts from Dhanikola and one stream ends at Panchpara & Satrapara, another stream ends at the Kuliya bil.

title: Magura
content: Magura river starts from Minhazpur and first stream ends at Shudrapur, second stream ends at the Hapati bil, third stream ends at Inayetpur & Syedpur.

title: Manda
content: Manda river starts from the Dhanu river and first stream ends at the Juyaira bil, second stream ends at the Fira gang, third stream ends at the Angan & Kim bil, forth stream ends at the Ghardoiyar river.

title: Mogha
content: Mogha river starts from the Katla bil and first stream ends at the Bapail bil, second stream ends at the North of Panahar.

title: Mari/Mori River
content: The river started from Sherpur, passed Mobarokpur and Rouhabetmari, then ended in a branch of Brahmaputra River.

title: Mirki River
content: This river originated from the Shomeshwari River which came from hill tracks of India and passed through Sherpur district.

title: Madardoh River
content: It started from Horkar Beel in Jamalpur and ended after joining Jhinai River in Gogonpur after going through Kilakili Beel and Pirgacha Beel.

title: Monglahat River
content: This river passed Pakundiya in Kishorgonj, Narandi, Patuyavanga, Bejurnala, Kahotor and ended in Digha beel.

title: Mrigi River
content: This river passed through Shribordi, Mrigi Beel, Gosaipur, Bisa Beel, Ishli Beel, Taki Beel, Kathaltola Beel and ended in Doshani River.

title: Miyabuya River
content: The river that flows towards the border of Valuka, Fulbari and Trishal in Mymensingh is known as Miyabuya River.

title: Mangaleshwari River
content: It originated from the Garo Hill track and is situated at Kalmakanda in Netrokona.

title: Mohadeo River
content: It is originated from the Garo Hill track at Kalmakanda and ended in the Kulihala river after passing Kochuyagara, Bamungao, Munshipur, Chikantop, Mohadeo and Kolaikandi.

title: Mohamaya Chara
content: More than one stream came out from the Mangalchandrabari Mountain and reached Feni and joined the Muhuri river at Satkhira.

title: Maiskhal Channel/ Moheshkhali Channel
content: It is situated in the Chokoriya Sundarbans at Cox’sbazar.

title: Matarbari Channel
content: It started from the joining point of Sikdarpara and Daoyakhali at Koheliya River in Coxsbazar and covered Matarbari, Molbil-Inakkhali-Modhukhali, Kalapara, Jamerkhal, Ghuriyakhali dil.

title: Moish River
content: It started from the Tripura hill tracks and fell into the Kahur River after flowing through Ketranga, Charigao, Mohammadpur, Kohur and Talbana.

title: Manikchori Khal
content: It started from between the ChiraDiya and the MaikhamaraDiya at the Matamuri Khal at Cox’s Bazar and flows until the Harbang Khal in Gobindopur.

title: Nurkhali River
content: Nurkhali river starts from the Larkhai river and ends at the Bolasmara river.

title: Nidhi Khal
content: Nidhi khal river starts from the Matijora river and ends at the Rajotni khal.

title: Nurkhai River
content: Nurkhai river starts from the Shekra rver and first stream ends at the Desa gang, second stream ends at the Chauralkhari river, third stream ends at Baghaoura.

title: Nalau River
content: Nalau river starts from the South of Bhatera hills and one stream ends at the Marua river, another stream ends at the Baulta bil.

title: Nagdara Gang
content: Nagdara gang starts from the North of Dewra bil and one stream ends at Betaowa, another stream ends at the Suray river.

title: Nalai Gang
content: Nalai gang starts from the Jharuya bil and ends at the Kushiyara river.

title: Nageshwari River
content: Nageshwari river starts from the North-West of Dapuniya and ends at the boundary of Trishal.

title: Nein Gang
content: Nein gang starts from the Surma river and ends at the Lakshmiprashad Amarikhal.

title: Nau Gang
content: Nau gang starts from the Lovachara tea garden and ends the Surma river.

title: Nun Chara
content: Nunchara starts from Nunchara tea garden & Lovachara tea garden and ends at the Lova river.

title: Noli Gang
content: Noli gang starts from Radhanagar and ends at Goragaon.

title: Nainda River
content: Nainda river starts from Ujanigaon of Surma river and ends at Mahasingha river.

title: Noya Gang
content: Noya gang starts from Kampur hat and ends at Sonatola kandi.

title: Norto River
content:
The genesis of this river is Beel area of Birganj Upazilla (Dinajpur) that fall into Punorvaba river. Length of this river is 8 km. Width is 1000   meters. Depth is 2.25 meters. The size of catchment area is 30 sq. km.
Streamflow depends on season with no influences of ebb and tide.

title: Noboganga River
content:
Near Chuadanga city, it’s originated that is the tributary of Mathabhanga river.  Through Chuadanga and Jhenaidah it meets with Kumar near Magura District.
Generally, Noboganga after Magura is the extended form of Kumar river.
The navigable route of Noboganga is meandering, but the river is free from breakdown prone habit.
The river isn’t navigable from Chuadanga to Magura. After that river is remaining navigable all round of the year.
The length of this river is 230 km. the average width to Magura is 200 meters and after that is 300 meters.
The water of this river is used as irrigation work with the help of pump setting various places from Chuadanga to Gazirhat of Magura. Built a dam from Kalachandpur to Gazirhat for controlling flood on the right side of the river. In the Project of Ganga – Kobodak Irrigation, there is a plan to use this infrastructure.

title: Norosunda River
content:
This is the tributary of Brahmaputra that coming out from Pakundia Upazilla (Kishoreganj), then flows through Karimganj, Deunda, Hosainpur, Ribari, Pakundia, Tarail, Kishoreganj Sadar, and Itna and at last fall into Dhonu river.
The total length of this river is 67 km. width is 35 meters. Depth is 4.95 meters. Size of catchment area is 2255 sq. km.
Generally, river banks drenched with flood waters. No influence of ebb and tide.

title: Nalchiti River
content:
Nalchiti river is the extended version of Arial Kahn and Kirtonkhola rivers.
This river flows through Nalchiti Upazilla of Jhalokathi and finally fall down into Bishkhali river near the town of Jhalokathi.
Jhalkathi Bandar town is situated on the confluence side of Jhalokathi and Nalchiti river. This place is recognized as a big market for Teak.

title: Noljur River
content:
This rive takes off from Makundo River and discharged into Khushiyara river at Derai Upazilla (Sunamganj).
The length of this river is 44km and width is 87 meters. Size of catchment is 160 sq. km.
River is free from ebb and tide that experienced flood in rainy season.

title: Nolshisha River
content:
Born from Patikaghat Beel of Parbotipur Upazilla (Dinajpur) that fall down in Korotoya river at Nawabganj Upazilla.
Streamflow depends on seasons. Length of this river is 36 km and width is 30 meters. Depth is 3 meters and catchment size is 125 sq. km.

title: Noloshri River
content: Where Bisharkandi and Harta river linked with each other (North Border of Banaripara Upazilla, Barisal) from that place flow south to Syedkathi Union and fallen into Sandhya river.

title: Noliya River
content: One tributaries of Noboganga flow south to near the village of Patna (Narail), known as Noliya river. Via Patna, Raypur, Sadhuhat, Kaliyabari village, it joined with Chitra river at Terkhada.

title: Niluya River
content: This river corrupted from Rupsha river at North Border of Baliyadanga Union, Baliyaghat Upazilla, Khulna that flows north – south as a zigzag pattern.

title: Noleya River
content: This river derived from Beel area of Pirganj Upazilla, Rangpur that flows through Polashbari, Sadullahpur Upazilla to join with Katakhakli – Korotoya – Bangali at Gobindaganj Upazilla, Gaibandha.   Total length of the river is 37 km. Width is 20 meters. Depth is 4 meters. Catchment area is 90 sq. km. This is seasonal river. No effect of ebb and tide.

title: Noyagang River
content:
It is also known as Kashiamara. Border river of India – Bangladesh.
Originated from Jaintia Hill of Khashia (India) that enter Bangladesh via Dowarabazar of Sunamganj district. Then travel 10 km to meet with Surma river.
Length of this river is 10 km and width is 20 meters. Catchment size is 30 sq. km. highest depth is 5 meters.
Water remaining throughout the year. No effect on ebb and tide.

title: Noyabhangani River
content:
Ousted from Arial Khan river near Kalinagar, through Idilpur and Srirampur, meets with Meghna river.
River length is 36 km. Width varies with seasons. In summer, width is 7.30 meters but winter, it is 1100 meters.  It is the new ditch of Padma river.

title: Nondokunja River
content:
Musakhan river that contains name as Nondokunja river at Kandir Para, after crossed few distance, Boral – Nondokunja joined with Barnoi river. Then confluence flow fall into Atrai river.
The nature of this river is seasonal. Length is about 20 km.

title: Nautara River
content:
This river originated from Lowland of East Chatnai, Dimala Upazilla (Nilphamari), that falls into Buritista river.
Length of this river is 22.8 km, width is 20 meters. Depth is 2.5 meters. Size of river basin is 30 sq. km. Streamflow remaining throughout the year. And free from ebb and tide.

title: Nagdagang River
content: This river coming out from Balu river that flows south – east to Bindan village. Famous Nagda Beel is located at the mouth of this river.

title: Nagor Lower River
content:
This river coming out from Korotoya river at Shibganj Upazilla (Bogra). Then first flows north – west and after turned into north to patch up with Atrai river at Singra Upazilla (Natore).
This river demarcated the boundary line of Atrai and Singra Upazilla. Length of this river is 105 km.

title: Nagor Upper River
content:
Originated from Meghalaya State. This river enters Bangladesh through near the Border Junction of Autwari and Panchagarh Sadar Upazilla of Panchagarh, and West Bengal.
Then this river flows through Atwari, Baliadangi, Ranisongkoil and Haripur Upazilla. And finally crossed Bangladesh again from Haripur Upazilla of Thakurgaon.
Length of this river is 50 km in Bangladesh. Width is 80 meters and depth is 5 meters.
Course of this river demarcate the boundary line of Bangladesh and India in many times.

title: Nangli River
content: This river born from Bangshi river at Bashail Upazilla (Tangail) to discharge into Pungli river.  Length of this river is 12 km. Width is 50 meters, depth is 6.25 meters. Catchment area has 50 sq. km.

title: Nanda River
content: It is coming out from lowland area of Gournadi Upazilla that enter Agailjhara Upazilla through Mahilara Upazilla. Then through Goila and Ratnopur Union (North – East Border area of Agailjhara Upazilla) this river flows south. And finally through North border of Uzirpur Upazilla it flows east – west to meet Uzirpur river.

title: Naf River
content:
It forms in the Arakan hills on the southern borders of the district and flows into the Bay of Bengal.
Length of this river is 62 km. Width is 1.6 km to 3.22 km.
It carries sediment and forming new land in the Bangladesh portion.This river is strongly influence by tide.

title: Naroda River
content:
Generated from Musa Khan river at Sadar Upazilla of Natore that discharged into Boral river at Singra Upazilla.
Pourosova of Natore Sadar is situated on the side of the river.
Length of this river is 35 km. Width is 18 meter. Depth is 5 meter. Basin size is 150 sq. km. This is seasonal river. No effect of ebb and tide on this river.

title: Nitai River
content:
Border River. This river originated in India. Its enter Bangladesh through Dhobaura of Mymensingh District. Then fallen into Konsho river of Netrokona Upazilla.
Length of this river is 35 km. Width 90 meters. Size of catchment area is 381 km.
Free from ebb and tide. Streamflow continued throughout the year.

title: Nironjon River
content: This river genesis from Sounrai Beel of Garamara that flows east to cross Fickchar Beel of Antohara Village, then flows through the side of Dariyal, Cheldhap, Brahmashali, Paikor, Narhotto etc. Villages and at last fallen into Nagor river which is located near Atail Chapapur

title: Nilkomol River
content:
Locally it known as Varani. This region known as Hiron Point. Here Bungalow of Port Authority, Naval Base are located.
This river is situated on the west bank of Pasur river. It flows west to fall into the estuary of Malaoncho river.

title: Nilgonja River
content: It is the tributary of Ramnabad river. At the Southside of Khepupara, this river flows east – west as crossways. The length of this river is about 35 km.

title: Nohaliya / Lohaliya River
content: This river originated from Khayarabada river which is the tributary of Kirtonkhola, flows on Barisal and Patuakhali. Then takes a name as Golachipa when flows more south oriented near Galachipa Upazilla. And finally fall into the Bay of Bengal.

title: Nurkhali River
content: It started flowing from Mostafapur of Dirai of Sunamganj and then divided into two branches. One flows upto Koitha and another fall into Singli River.

title: Nanda River
content: It started flowing from upstream of Surma River at Sirajpur in Sunamganj district.

title: Nokaria Chora
content: It started flowing from Khasia Pahar of India and entered into Bangladesh through Muradpur Border of Sunamganj and fall into Surma at the west of Ballavpur.

title: Nanda River
content: It started flowing from Hasampur and Noagaon of Mahasingha River at Dirai Upazilla and fall into Surma River at Ujanigaon.

title: Noyondar Patna Gang
content: It started from the North-west part of Kutankhala Beel at Khaliyajuri, Netrokona and ended in the Dhanu River after circulating the beel.

title: Nomami River
content: This river originated from the Surma river and flows between Amilpur and Ammar and divides into two part in Lalarchar.

title: Narkila gang
content: It was originated from Sunamganj zilla, divided into many branch and fall at buri river.

title: Nalbunia River
content: It emerges at the boundary of Rajpur (Jhalkathi) and Vandaria (Pirojpur) upazila  and ends at Adakhola upazia

title: Naovasoman  River
content: It is a trans-boundary river which originates at sharsa upazila of Chuadanga district and West Bengal and by meeting with Arial Khan river at Daulatpur.

title: Nanda River
content: It originates at Ujirpur and Agoiljhora upazila’s boundary and meets with Ujirpur river

title: Nalua River
content: The boundary of Chitolmari and Mollarat upazila of Magerhat district is the source region of this river. This river flows upto Kochuria.

title: Nirishkhali River
content: Mohammadpur Upazila of Magura district is the origin place of this river. And then ends by meeting with Bishkhali river at Rajpur.

title: Nali River
content: The sadar upazila of Pirojpur district is the origin place for this river. It has two main flows. One of them ends at Halta river and another at Shapleja Canal.

title: Nidra Bharani River
content: Horinghata of Borguna district is the source area of this small river that is from Burishoe river. It then meets with Andharmanik river

title: Nolosri River
content: Banaripara upazila of Barisal district is the origin place of this river. This river ends by meeting with Sondha river.

title: Nehalganj River
content: The kalabad river at Barisal district is the source area of this river that ends by meeting with Rangamatia river.

title: Nolshi River
content: Banaripara of Barisal district is te origin place of this river that falls into Sondha river at Sayedkathi.

title: Nanhori River
content: It started from Kuliya and Pataddor in Comilla and joined the Dakatiya river after crossing Krishnapur, Hinguya, Doulatpur and Boropathar.

title: Nagaliya Rivar
content: This river started from Kochalai in Comilla and got mixed with Kanail river at Chadpur.

title: Nondiya Gang
content: It originated from Behel Chok situated at the border of Betal and Suchana in Tahirpur, Sunamganj and started towards Barunka and Doulatpur.

title: Ogura River
content: The North-western part of Khaliadanga at Khulna district is the source region of this river that ends by meeting with Ichamoti river.

title: Old Brahmaputra River
content:
This tributary ousted from Brahmaputra river at Dewanganj Upazilla (Jamalpur) that confluence with Meghna river at Bhairab Upazilla (Kishoreganj). It travels Dewanganj, Islampur, Melandah, Jamalpur Sadar, Mymensingh Sadar, Iswarganj, Nandail, Goffargaon, Pakundia, Katiadi, Kuliarchar, and Bhairab Upazilla.
Now it patches up with Shitolaksha river to confluence with Meghna and Dhaleshwari river. Tributaries of this river are Jhinai, Banar, Shirkhali, Sutiya etc.
River length is 240 sq. km. Width is 200 meters. Depth is 6.5 meters. Basin size is 5431 sq. km.Stream flows remaining throughout the year. Have an effect of ebb and tide.

title: Old Surma River
content:
This river coming out from Surma river at Sadar Upazilla of Sunamganj that fallen into Kalni river at Derai.
Length of this river is 40 km. Width is 100 meters. Basin size is 150 sq. km.No effect of ebb and tide.

title: Panguchi River
content: It originates from Ghosiakhali river at Morolganj upazila of Bagerhat district. Then this river meets with Boleshor river at Bodnivanga.

title: Pona River
content: This river has been originated from the boundary line of Vandaria nad Rajapura and flows toward katakhali river at tharkhali boundary

title: Pondrodone River
content: This river has been originated from Boleshor river at the boundary line of Vandaria nad Mothbaria upazila and flows toward Burichor estuary.

title: Palang River
content: It emerges from Arial Khan river at the boundary line of Shariatpur and madaripur district and ends by meeting with Moynakata river at Kutubpur.

title: Purushali River
content: It originates from Garadoho Canal at Modhukhali, Faridpur and ends by meeting with Chandana.

title: Pathuria River
content: Sarankohola upazila is the source region of this river that falls into Bilesshor river.

title: Pancha Koralia River
content: The burishor river at Amtoli Upazila is the source area of this river. It ends at Chandkhali by meeting with Chakamaia river

title: Poisha River
content: Kotalipara Upazila of Gopalganj district is the source region of this river that ends at Ambara by meeting with Satla river

title: Pando River
content: Rangamatia river at Barisal district is the main source area of this short river that meets with Barisal river after following about 12km.

title: Pirali Gang
content: It started flowing from Borak River at Modon Upazilla of Habiganj.

title: Perua River
content: It started flowing from Jagbantpur of Dirai Upazilla, Sunamganj and flows upto Mohit/Moit.

title: Putia Gang
content: It started flowing from Dahuka River at Bahrampur of Dirai Upazilla, Sunamganj and fall into Halda River at Isakpur, Srirampur and Kochagaon.

title: Pagla River
content: It started flowing from west side of Meghna River at Nabinagar Upazilla and then divided into two branches. One fall into Titas river at Krishnanagar and the other fall into Meghna River at Chor Laspur.

title: Purakai River
content: It started flowing from south-west border of Jaintapur and joined with Lain and Heyar River.

title: Porajuri River
content: It started flowing from Dengar River of Jaintapur Upazilla  and flows through Chotakandi, Kaurer Kandi, Dhaleshwari and Chalia.

title: Palali River
content: It started flowing from Bhatgaon and Raglajur swamps of Chatak Upazilla and flows upto Palali Beel Chatrish(36).

title: Putaka River
content: It started flowing from Meghna Beel of Dirai Upazilla of Sunamganj and fall into Surma River near Gachia and Rajnagar.

title: Peru/Perua River
content: It started flowing from south-western border of Dirai Upazilla and ended flowing upto a swamp area of north-west.

title: Panatirtha River
content: It started from kalikapur of the Jadukata River in Sunamganj and passed Rajpara, Konahat, Chatal Beel, Isabpur, Sotis, Suyala, Madhabpur and falls in the river Baulai in Fajilpur.

title: Paruli River
content: This river started from the south-east of Sripur and flows by the east of Gesinga and Ijjotpur rail station and ended in the Balu river in Rajbari.

title: Piyain gang
content: Lamni, khuri etc are situated on the bank of this river.

title: Patuakhali River
content:
This river generated from Nohaliya river at Sadar Upazilla of Patuakhali that falls into Payra river.
Length of this river is 6 km. Width is 300 meters. Depth of this river is 6 meters. Size of catchment area is 30 sq. km.
Generally, this is flood prone river. Due to that reason dam was built both side of the river which length is 6 km.

title: Padma River
content:
This is the major river of Bangladesh that originates from the Himalaya and enters Bangladesh from India. In Bangladesh it meets with Meghna and got the name Meghna.
The total length of Ganga – Padma river system is about 2600 km. In Bangladesh, the length of Ganga is 258 km, starting with western Border of India to its confluence with Jamuna at Goalandaghat. The Padma is 126 km long, running from Goalandaghat confluence to Chandpur where it joins the Meghna.
This was a mighty one but day by day it is becoming merge. This is due to Farrakah Dam, which was set up in India.

title: Pashur River
content: The land between the Pashur and the Bhola is drained by the Sela, which lies wholly within the Sundarbans. Many cross channels connect it with the systems on either side. A large cross channel connects it with the Morzal at the head of its estuary. The pashur river is a continuation of the Rupsha, which is formed of the union of the Bhiaraband Atrai rivers. At present, much of its water is from the Garai diverted through the Noboganga. From near Batighata Upazilla the Rupsha changes its name to Kazibacha, which is given up near Chalna in favor of Pashur. Near the Mongla Port, the Pashur receives Mongla river and near the forest outpost at Chandpai it receives the Mirgamari cross channel from the Bhola, both on the leftbank. On the rightbank the Manki, Dhaki and Bhadra are connected with Shibsha system.

title: Poysha River
content: This is the river of Agailjhara upazila, Barisal. On the side of this river, a market was established which recognized as Poyshar Hat.

title: Pagla River
content:
This is a border river which origin place is India that enter Bangladesh through Shipganj Upazilla, Chapai Nawabganj.
Length of this river is 44 km, width is 90 meters, and depth is 4.5 meters.
River which flows between Ancient Gouro and Tanda city, known as Pagla. Water flows throughout the year. Free from ebb and tide.

title: Panga River
content:
Panga river flows on the side of Singrot Village (East side of Chaklahat Union, Panchagarh District.)
This river flows parallel to the Indian border which originated place is Hilly region of Jalpaiguri district that streams 6 km in Bangladesh and then again enter into Jalpaiguri.
The depth of this river is 18 meters. This is flood prone river. It travels through Kaharpara, Fokirganj, Mondolghat, Berubari etc. region, then enters into Bangladesh and again reaches Jalpaiguri through Borkamta region that re – enters into Bangladesh from Nautari.

title: Patki River
content:
This river takes off from the Katali Moujar swamp land, Panchagarh. Then confluence with Nagor river at Bodhgaon Mouja, Atwari Thana.
Length of this river is 12 km. Average width is 40 meters.
This is about dry in summer. But depth of this river increased in the rainy season is about 6 meters.

title: Patnai – Paikartola River
content:
This river derived from Mahram river at Tahirpur Upazilla, Sunamganj that falls into Someshwari river at the same Upazilla.
Length of this river is 13 km. Width is 80 meters. Depth is 8 meters. Catchment size is 60 sq. km.  This is flood prone river.

title: Pandob River
content: It flows from the east side of Bakerganj Upazilla, Barisal.

title: Pando River
content: This river flows north to south as a zigzag style in Bakerganj Upazilla. This river flows south to meet Korkhana river through Kabai and Kalashkathi Union.

title: Patharghata River
content:
The genesis of this river is Beel area of Birganj Upazilla, Dinajpur that mixed up with Chota Dhepa river.
River length is 16 km. Width is 10 meters. Depth is 2.5 meters and basin size is 50 sq. km. This is seasonal river and free from ebb and tide.

title: Pathoraj River
content:
Birth place is Meghalaya state, India. Through Moynadeghi Beel of Boda Upazilla, Panchagarh, it’s fallen into Korotoya river at Debiganj Upazilla.
Length of this river is 36 km, width is 60 meters, and depth is 3.5 meters. Size of catchment area is 144 sq. km.
Water remaining throughout the year. No effect of tide and ebb on this river.

title: Panguchi River
content:
This river ousted from Ghoshiakhali river of Morelganj Upazilla, Bagerhat that joined with Boleshwar river.
River length is 29 km. Width is 850 meters. Depth is 18 meters. Basin size is 120 sq. km.
Stream flows throughout the year.

title: Payra River, Patuakhali
content:
Lohaliya and Payra river joined by Patuakhali river at Sadar Upazilla, Patuakhali. Kochabaniya river, which comes from Rajagonj river, flows north – south to link with Potuakhali and Payra river through Badarpur Itabariya Union (Patuakhali Sadar). From confluence place, taking a name as Payra that mixed with Rajagonj river. There is no mender on this river. It straightly meets with Rajagonj.
The length of this river is 4 km.

title: Palardi River, Madaripur
content: It originated from Turkey river of Ramjanpur Union, Kalkini Upazilla that crosses Koyariya Union and meets with Arial Khan through Char Alimabad region of Muladi Upazilla.

title: Pahariya River
content:
This river derived from Arial Khan at Monohardi Upazilla, Norshingdi that crosses Raipur Upazilla and again fall into Arial Khan.
Length of this river is 20 km. Width is 100 meters. Depth is 7 meters. Catchment size is 100 sq. km.  Stream flows whole years.

title: Piyain River
content:
This river originated from Om or Omgot river of Assam that enters Bangladesh through Gowainghat Upazilla, Sylhet.
Slightly change its course near Protappur Border Outpost after flowing 7 km in Bangladesh parallel to the International boundary and fall into Surma river. Near Protappur Border Outpost river divided into three courses likely Old Piyain, Pobitrodala and Noyadala.
At present main course of Piyain river meets with Sarigowain river in the downtream through Noyadala. Old piyain and Poobitrodala get their flow only in the rainy season.
Total length of this river is 145 km. It has 22 bent in 80 km route of Jaflong to Chatok. Due to flash flood here created advanced flood.

title: Piyang River
content:
The genesis place of this river is Veramohon Beel of Sulla Upazilla, Sunamganj that falls into Dhonpur Khal near Itna Upazilla of Kishoreganj.
Length of this river is only 6 km. Width is 70 meters. Basin size is 18 sq. km.  River shows seasonal water flow. There is no flow in January to March. Peak flow seen only July – August. There is no influence of ebb and tide.

title: Pungli River
content:
This is the tributary of Dhaleshwari river that ousted from Kalahati Upazilla, Tangail which patch up with Bangshi river at Bashail Upazilla through Sadar Upazilla of Tangail.
River length is 40 km. Width is 110 meters. Depth is 10 meters. Size of catchment area is 185 sq. km.  This is seasonal river and has no effect of ebb and tide.

title: Putimari River
content:
This river generated in Daratana river at Bagerhat Sadar that discharged into Dawodkhali river.
Length of this river is 10.5 km, width is 40 meters, depth is 3 meters and basin size is 40 sq. km.
Stream flows throughout year. And influenced by ebb and tide.

title: Purushali River, Rajbari
content: This river originated from Lowland area of Baliakandi Upazilla, Rajbari that flows south – west to joined with Gorai river through Jangal Union, North – west border of Madhukhali Upazilla (Faridpur) and re – enter into Baliakandi Upazilla.

title: Petki River
content:
Origin place of this river is Beel Area of Atwari Upazilla that flows a zigzag style and finally fall down into Nagor river.  LGED built up sluice gate on this river.
Length of this river is 10 km. Width is 35 meters. Depth is 3 meters. Size of drainage basin is 28 sq. km.
Water flow continuing throughout the year. No effect of ebb and tide. This isn’t flood prone river.

title: Pona River, Perojpur
content: This river joined with Kotcha river at Vandaria Upazilla. This river contain various water of Khal and Beel that come from Bhandaria, Kathalia, Rajpur, and Mothbaria areas. Length of this river is 15 km.

title: Polimari River
content: This river ousted between North Maksudpara and Lakshanpur of Badarganj Upazilla, Rangpur that meets with Ghadangi Nala at West Ghatbeel and finally confluence with Chikli river.

title: Pocha Baral
content: This river ousted from Haroa of Bonpara, Baraigram Upazilla, Nator that falls into Baral at Haolia Village.

title: Pagaria River
content: This river derived from Rasulpur (Border area of Gaforgaon and Trishal of Mymensingh District) that keeps Jessore on East side and divided into two branches. They are patched up near North side of Moshakhali through Raona Beel and West side of Raonadi. After that it’s confluence with Railan river.

title: Palashbari River
content: Which coming out from Atrai river that meets with Kalikapur Khal through Naogaon Beel and after that meets with Chota Jamuna.

title: Palki River
content: Streams that coming out from Nagao River at Atwari Upazilla Panchagarh that flows through Nitupara of Tariya Union and ends at the front of Bala Dangi Hat where river follows a meandering route.

title: Pahar Bari Khari
content: Ousted from Pathar Bam Mahendrapur that flows parallel to the Upazilla boundary.

title: Paikpara Khari
content: This river respectively comes out from Bara Chanshara Barabeel and Chota Chanshara Barabeel at Porsha Upazilla, Naogaon and meets with Pathardanga Khari.

title: Pathari River
content: Ousted from North boundary of Debipur which found between Thakurgaon Sadar Upazilla and Boda Upazilla and advanced up to Kalitola Hat.

title: Panga River
content: This river ousted from Jalpaiguri, India and meets with Jamuna river at Barashashi.

title: Patha Kata River
content: Ousted from Lalabeel and Faridpur beel of Thakurgaon Sadar Upazilla that ends up at Kharikadam through Brahmanvita.

title: Putaka
content: Putaka river starts from the Amarpur & Dasukha bil and ends at Magura.

title: Palali
content: Palali river starts from the Lakash Hasham bil and ends at the Padma bil.

title: Pabijuri
content: Pabijuri gang starts from the Maguri bil and ends at the Baoyar bil.

title: Patal
content: Patal river covers Kolmakanda near Garo hill of India.

title: Pagodiya
content: Pagodiya river starts from the Churkhai khal and ends at the Chechuya bil.

title: Pagariya
content: Pagariya river starts from the estuary of Pagodiya river and one stream ends at mondariya & Aponhala, another stream ends at Garagaon.

title: Piyali
content: Piyali river starts from the Satgaon bil and first stream ends at the Pagna bil, second stream ends at the Halda river.

title: Puthi
content: Puthi chara starts from the Hatal bil and ends at Prithi Chara tea garden.

title: Panda
content: Panda river starts from the Naowa river and ends at Mohanpur.
