title: Putia Gang
content: It started flowing from east border of Dirai Upazilla and fall into Dahuka River in Bahrampur.

title: Putla
content: Putla river starts through Charkai & Damudartapi and ends at the Mahasingha river.

title: Paruli River
content: It came out from the west of Sripur, passed Rajbari and Rajendropur and reached Kaliganj border after joining Balu river in Gazipur.

title: Pother Kata River
content: The river that flows from the border of Ajmiriganj and Mymensingh to Alipur Bari, Jami Goyalgao and bari chak is named as Pother Kata River.

title: Pagli Chara
content: It originated from Tripura and ended in the Chaita Tali Chara after passing Jashpur, Sobahanpur, Rampur, Manipur, Noyapara, Bogalpur and Kuriyapara.

title: Pagli River
content: There are two rivers by this name.

title: Rubishwar River
content: Rubishwar river starts from the Shwameshwari river and ends at Nania.

title: Rongsa River
content: Rongsa river starts from Chak Dhakirkanda and ends at the Koilo Mogra river.

title: Rala River
content: Rala river starts from the Dashghar bil and ends at the Pagla bil.

title: Ratna River
content: Ratna river starts from the Rakoya bil and first stream ends at the Chaiya bil, second stream ends at the Noyakandi bil, third stream ends at the Bhanga river.

title: Ratuya Gang
content: Ratuya gang starts from Baudaran and first stream ends at the Jaliyagang, second stream ends at Halikona.

title: Rakhushini River
content: This river takes off from middle of the Mahadebpur and Bakultola Bazar (Thakurgaon Sadar) that patch up with Tulai river at Akhpa.

title: Rakeshwari River
content: It is ousted from Ichamati river at Sathiya Upazilla, Pabna that falls into Jamuna river through Vatiya Chara.

title: Rani River
content: This is the tributary of Atrai river that ousted from Atrai at Jotbazar Trimohani of Nurullabad Union, Naogaon and meets with Chaota Jamuna at Barohatti.

title: Railan River
content: This river comes out from North side of Raona of gaforgaon Upazilla, Mymensingh and flows advanced up to North – East Poidhala.

title: Rotha River
content: This river flows within Chava union of Atgharia Upazilla, Pabna that originated and fallen in Chiknai River.

title: Ruknai River
content: This river coming out from Baral river at Deoyabaria and Ratanpur of Sathiya Upazilla, Pabna that meets with Chiknai river at Sabar Thagbaria.

title: Ramdara River
content: Ousted from Belpara of Thakurgaon Sadar which flows towards Raghunathpur.

title: Rasia River
content: Coming out between Borolia and Fariyapara Sakin Barolia that meets with Tangon River at eastern side of Radhanagar.

title: Rata Chora
content: It started flowing from Meghalaya of India and entered into Bangladesh through Kanaighat, Sylhet and joined with Dona River at Madarpur.

title: Raji River
content: It started from the estuary of Dulai and Baruni River at Nettrokona and flows until Modon Sub district.

title: Ramchondi/Ronochondi River
content: It originates from Meghalaya of India. Ramchondi River flows from Tetulia of Panchagarh and fall at Mahanonda River. Its length is 10 kilometers and width 7 meters. Its depth is 3 meters. It covers 25 square kilometers.

title: Ramnabad River
content: It started flowing from Agunmukho River of Golachipa Upazilla, Patuakhali and fall at Bay of Bengal in Kolapara Upazilla. Its length is 35 kilometers and width 4 kilometer. Its depth is 26 meters. It covers 125 kilometers floodplain.

title: Raimangal River
content: Raimangal River originated from Hugli river of Pashchim Bongo, India. Then, it started to flow through Shyamnagar Upazilla, Satkhira after entering into Bangladesh. In this way, it merged with Kalindi River in the border of Bangladesh-India and headed towards south. Later, one of its branch fall at Bay of Bengal through the Sundarbans after joining with the Jamuna. Another branch merged with Hariabhanga River. Finally it fall into Bay of Bengal naming Horinbhanga from northern side of Madarbari Chor. Length of Raimangal river is 40 km and width 100 meters. Its depth is 14 meters. This river is the biggest river of western side of Sundarbans.

title: Rupsa River
content: Rupsa River was created as a canal in 19th century connecting Bhairab and Kazibacha rivers. It falls into Bay of Bengal naming Poshur from southern side of Mongla port. The length of Rupsa River is 11 km and width is 400 meters. Its depth is 17 meters. It covers 2935 square kilometers area.

title: Rupsa River
content: It is the branch of Longon Balvadra river of Nasirnagar Upazilla, Brahmanbaria. It fall into Meghna River. Its length is 10 km, width 100 meters. Its depth is 4.5 meters. It covers 1935 square kilometers land.

title: Rengkhiang River
content: This river originated by joining some small streams from south-western side of border area of Mizoram, India and entered into Bangladesh at the Rengkhiang reserve forest area of Rangamati. It fall into south-eastern side of Kaptai Lake near Bilaichori. Its length is 77 km.

title: Rezu River
content: It originates from northern Arakan mountains and fall into Bay of Bengal by the south border of Cox’s Bazar. It’s also called Rezu Canal. Its length or width is unknown.

title: Rangajan
content: Rangajan river starts from the Hal jatihat, Gazni, Naokuchi of Sherpur and ends at Kalorkanda.

title: Ramkhali
content: Ramkhali starts from the Barbil and ends at the Bhogai river.

title: Rangamati River
content: It’s a very small river that flows through North-West of Savar.

title: Ratna-Satai River
content: It started from Lakhai and Astagram and ended in the Barak River in Habiganj.

title: Rangapani River
content: It originated from the Indian mountains at Jaintapur and reached Lakkhipur after passing Beleti Beel.

title: Reju khal
content: It originated from the Bandarban hill tracks and fall into the Bay of Bengal after passing Rejupara, Doriyar Dighi, Boro Beel, Chechuyapalang, Dhoyapalang, Ujaliya Khal, Uhala Palang, Jaliyapalong, Sonarpara and Manglapara.

title: Rajkhali Khal
content: It is situated in Chakariya in Cox’s Bazar and crossed Volakhal, Bajarpara, Ajgor Ali Bazar, Doshergona, Jalakathi, Ailarpara, Noyakhal and endind at Naptakhali.

title: Rangkhali River
content: It started from the lowland of Rajghatapara in Matarbari island in Cox’s Bazar and ended in the Matarbari channel.

title: Shakbaria River
content: It started from Shibsa river of Koira Upazilla, Khulna and fall into Arpangashia river of the same Upazilla. Its length is 22.5 km, length 800 meters and depth 10 meters. It covers an area of 88 square km as its river basin.

title: Shib-Barnoi-Gurnai River
content: From Manda Bil of Tanor Upazilla of Rajshahi, Shib river flows as Barnoi river towards north-eastern direction after taking a big turn near Nouhata. Barnoi river then merged with Gurnoi river near Morkol Bazar. This joint river then started to flow towards south and finally it fall into Hurashagor. Total length of the river is 130 km.

title: Shib River
content: It started to flow from Atrai river of Mohadebpur Upazilla of Naogaon and flows through Manda of same district and Mohanpur of Rajshahi. Then it fall into Barnoi river at Poba Upazilla. Its length is 57 km, width 60 meters and depth 4.5 meters. Its river basin area is 250 square km.

title: Shibsa River
content: Its one of the largest river of Sundarbans. Its one the two branches of Poshur river near Mongla-Chalna port and fall at Bay of Bengal taking the name Kunga near estuary. Mainly it originates from Kopotakkho river near Raruli of Dakop Upazilla of Khulna. Its length is 100 km, width 3 km in Paikgacha and depth 17 meters. Near Paikgacha, the river basin area is 400 square km.

title: Shilchori River
content: It’s a tributary of Karnafuli river. Starting from northern area of Sitapahar Uttolvongo, it fall into Karnafuli river near Shilchori Bazar. Its length is 1.3 km.

title: Shitalokkhya River
content: It’s a branch river of Old Brahmaputra. It started flowing from the area where old Brahmaputra and Banar river joined together. It fall into Dholeshwari near south of Modonganj flowing through kapasia, Kaliganj and Narayanganj. Its length is 73 km, width 273 meters and depth 14 meters near Demra. Its river basin area is 3803 square km.

title: Shila River
content: It started flowing from Dewanbari canal, Bokabil, Kan canal and low lands of nearby of Trishal Upazilla of Mymensing and fall into Sutia river at Goforgaon Upazilla. Its length is 73.25 km, width 75 meters and depth 2.8 meters. River basin area is 270 square km.

title: Shuk River
content: It originates from swamps of Patiadangi Hat of Thakurgaon Sadar Upazilla and fall into Tangon river of same district. Its length is 30 km, width 20 meters and depth 4.5 meters. Its river basin area is 100 square km.

title: Shela River
content: It started flowing from Bhola river and and it fall in Poshur river and Bhola river.

title: Sholmari River
content: It started flowing from Kazibacha river of Batiaghata Upazilla of Khulna and fall into Bhodra river of Batiaghata. Its length is 29 km, width 150 meters and depth 12.75 meters. River basin area is 140 square km.

title: Shoildoho River
content: It’s also called “Saldha” or “Shoilodha”. It falls into Kaligonga river near Chitolmari and Nazirpur Upazilla.

title: Srinodi / Chiri River
content: It originates from Bil Paira of Fultola Upazilla of Khulna and fall into Bhairab river of Dumuria Upazilla. Its length is 25.75 km, width 30 meters and depth 4.6 meters. Its river basin area is 125 square km.

title: Shrimoti / Chiramoti River
content: This river originates from a big swamp area of border area of Hemtabad Upazilla, Dinajpur. It fall into Mohanonda at Malda district of Paschimbongo, India flowing through Kachna, Medenipur, Majhiar, Patirajpur and Digholdanga.

title: Srimont River
content: It started from Paira river of Mirjaganj Upazilla of Patuakhali and fall into same Paira river. Its length is 20 km, width 200 meters and depth 9 meters. Its river basin area is 80 square km.

title: Shonchoi River
content: It’s a tributary. It originated from Dhopaghata of Jhinaidoho and flows through Phursondi and kushobaria.

title: Soti-Shornomoti-Vateshwari River
content: It started flowing from Harishwar Bil of Kaliganj Upazilla, Lalmonirhat and fall into Tista river at Lalmonirhat Sadar Upazilla. It flows through kaliganj, Aditmari to Lalmonirhat. Its length is 60 km, width 50 meters and depth 4 meters. Its river basin area is 110 square km.

title: Shondha River
content: This river started flowing from Arial Kha river of Babuganj Upazilla of Barisal and fall into Kocha river of Kaokhali Upazilla, Pirojpur. It flows through Babuganj, Uzirpur, Shwarupkathi, Bnaripara and Kaokhali. Its length is 45 km, width 1 km and depth 21 meters. It covers 106 square km river basin area.

title: Sangu River
content: It originates from Arakan Mountains of Myanmar and entered into Bangladesh through Thanchi Upazilla of Bandarban. Then, through Thanchi, Ruma, Roangchori, Bandarban Sadar, Satkania, Chondnaish, Anoara and Bashkhali, it fall into Bay of Bengal. Its length is 180 km, width 150 meters and depth 15 meters. It has a river basin area of 1275 square km. Marma people call this river “Sabak Khiyang” and in Bandarban, its known as “Rigre Khiyang”.

title: Sapleza River
content: It flows through Mothbaria Upazilla of Pirojpur.

title: Sarigoain River
content: It’s a border river. It started flowing from Lovachora river near Lalakhal tea states and entered into Bangladesh through Jointapur, Sylhet. It flows through Jointapur, Goainghat, Kompanigonj and Sylhet Sadar and fall into Surma river at Kompaniganj as “Singarkhal”. Its length is 25.75 km, width 117 meters at Sarighat and depth 8.5 meters. It covers 75 square km river basin area.

title: Salta River
content: It originates from Bhadra river at Dumuria Upazilla of Khulna and fall into Kazibacha river at Batiaghata Upazilla. Its length is 13 km, width 100 meters and depth 14 meters. Its river basin area is 39 square km.

title: Salda River
content: It’s a border river. It originates from Tripura of India and entered into Bangladesh through Brahmanpara of Comilla. Then it fall into Buri river at Kosba Upazilla of Brahmanbaria. Its length is 27 km. Near Salda Rail Bridge area, its width is 30 meters and depth 3.5 meters. It has a river basin area of 221 square km.

title: Shahebkhali River
content: It started flowing from Kalindi river at Khusba or Ambaria village and fall into Raimangal river at south-western border area of Satkhira.

title: Singua River
content: It originates from Khamabil of Pakundia Upazilla of Kishorganj and fall into Ghorautra river of Nikli Upazilla. It flows through Pakundia, Kishorganj Sadar, Kotiadi and Nikli. Its length is 48 km, width 30 meters and depth 4.9 meters. Its river basin area is 200 square km.

title: Sirajpur Haor River
content: It originates from Gorai river at Khoksa Upazilla of Kustia and fall into the same river at Pangsha Upazilla, Rajbari. Its length is 30 km, width 120 meters and depth 10 meters. Its river basin area is 125 square km.

title: Sukhdoho River
content: It’s a feeder of Bangali river of Bagura. It originates from Bangali river near Kabilpur and flows through koromzahat and Fulbari. It fall into Velka river near Durgahata.

title: Sugondha River
content: It started flowing from Kirtonkhola river through Barisal Sadar and Nolchiti Upazilla and fall into Bishkhali river at Rajapur Upazilla of Jhalkathi. Its length is 30 km, width 1 km and depth 19 meters. Its river basin area is 120 square km.

title: Sutang River
content: It’s a border river. It originates from hilly area of Amu tea estates at Chunarughat Upazilla of Habiganj and flows through Chunarughat, Habiganj Sadar, Lakhai Upazilla. It falls into Kalni river at Lakhai Upazilla. Its length is 85 km, width 80 meters and deph 4 meter near Sutang Railway Bridge. It has a river basin area of 400 square km.

title: Sutikhali River
content: It originates from Chiknai river at Sathia Upazilla of Pabna and fall into Hurashagor of Bera Upazilla. Its length is 12 km, width 50 meters and depth 4 meters. Its river basin area is 36 square km.

title: Sutia River
content: It started flowing from Brahmaputra river at Mymensing Sadar and fall into Banar river at Goforgaon Upazilla. It flows through Trishal Upazilla. Its length is 95.5 km, width 80 meters and depth 3 meters. Its river basin area is 380 square km.

title: Supti River
content: It originated from 15 km north of the estuary of Boleshwar river at Bagerhat.

title: Surma River
content: Surma river is one of the main rivers of Sylhet division. It originated from Borak river of India and fall into Meghna river at 300 km downstream. It flows through Jakiganj, Kanaighat, Bianibazar, Golapganj, Sylhet Sadar, Bishwanath, Chatak, Doarabazar, Sunamganj Sadar and Ajmiriganj. Its length is 245 km, width 90 meters and depth 12.28 meters. It has a river basin of 7476 square km.

title: Senua River
content: It originated from the low lands of Dorajgaon area of Thakurgaon Sadar and fall into Tangon river of the same Upazilla. Its length is 25 km, width 20 meters and depth 3.5 meters. It covers 60 square km river basin.

title: Selonia River
content: It’s a border river. It originates from Tripura of India and fall into Muhuri river through Fulgazi, Feni Sadar and Chagolnaiya. Its length is 56 km. In Malipur, its width is 28 meters and depth 4 meters. River basin area of Selonia river is 300.62 square km.

title: Sonai River
content: The river originated from the hilly areas of Tripura, India. It fell into the river Khasti after entering into Bangladesh through Madhabpur, Habigonj. The length of the river is 24 km. Its width is 250m and its depth is 5m. The basin of this river is 120 sq. km in area.

title: Sonai River
content: This river originated from the Isamoti River that flows in the border of Kolaroya, Satkhira. It passed through Kolaroya again and fall into the Isamoti river of Indian border. In upstream, Sonai is a branch of Jamuna river situated in West Bengal. Then it entered into Chobbish Porgona near Chanduriya. The length of this River is 7.4km, width is 200m. Its depth is 3m and its basin is 28 sq.km.

title: Sonaichori River
content: The river was formed from a hilly stream of Lama in Bandarban. It ended after falling into the river Matamuhuri in Chokoriya, Coxs Bazar. The length of the river is 24.5 km and its width is 40m. Its depth is 3m and its basin is 100 sq.km.

title: Sonai-Borodol River
content: The river originated from the hilly areas of Asham in India and entered into Bangladesh through Biyanibazar in Sylhet district. It met up with the river Kushiyara after dividing the sub-districts Borolekha and Biyanibazar. Its length is 19 km. Its width is 98m and its basin is of 50 sq.km.

title: Sonatola River
content: This river originated from River Tiyakhali which is situated in Kolapara, Potuakhali and ended after falling into the river Andharmanik of this sub-district. The length of this river is 18 km and its width is 350m. Its depth is 17.5m and the area of its basin is 75 sq.km.

title: Somashwori River
content: The river originated from the Garo Mountain of Meghalaya. It headed towards the east after flowing through Durgapur, Netrokona. It falls into the Baluya River situated in Jamalgonj of Sunamgonj district after reaching Dhormoshala and flowing southwards. The length of this river is 113km. Its width is 800m and its depth is 8m. The area of its basin is 1197 sq.km.

title: Shal River
content: This river has been originated from Poshur river at the boundary line of Rampal and Dapok upazila and flows toward Ichamotii river at Chak-Gona.

title: Sultani River
content: This river emerges from the boundary line of Mehendiganj (Barisal) and Bhola sadar upazila and ends at Tentulia of Bhola district.

title: Shela River
content: It emerges from Bhola river at Bagerhat district and ends by meeting with bangra river.

title: Sorongakati River
content: Sharupkathi  is the source region of this river which ends by falling into Krishnakati river.

title: Shel River
content: Poshr river at Khulna district is the emerged region of this river that have different three distributaries.

title: Solitakhali River
content: Bagerhat district is the confluence region of this river. This river has two distributaries.

title: Shalikha River
content: It originates from Tala upazila at Launch Ghat and falls into Kopotakkho river at Thuba-gachi.

title: Shukh River
content: Gangrel river at Boroitola of Khulna district is the source region of this river and ends by meeting with Vangaria river at Khagrabunia.

title: Satla River
content: Kotalipara Upazila of Gopalganj district is the source region of this river that ends at Kazihorthi by meeting with Hata river

title: Shams River
content: This river emerges from Kalganj Upazila of Jhinaidah district that runs through Baro Bazar about 9 km.

title: Sati River
content: It started flowing from Rainaghat of Ratna River at Habiganj Sadar Upazilla and fall into Bali River.

title: Shakhati Gang
content: It started flowing from Goakarabeel and Gopalpur and joined with Khoyai River in Habiganj.

title: Shirkhali River
content: It started flowing from Rothkhola Bazar of Muktagacha and Jamalpur Sadar Upazilla and flows upto North-Eastern side of Theruajani.

title: Sophia River
content: It started flowing from Tulapara of Nasirnagar Upazilla of Brahmanbaria and fall into Titas River.

title: Sunalhar River
content: It started flowing from Uttor Niamatpur Arji of border of Nasirnagar and Sarail Upazilla of Brahmanbaria and fall into Titas River.

title: Subia River
content: It started flowing from Netrokona Sadar Upazilla and Gouripur Sadar Upazilla and fall into Saiduli River.

title: Shirka River
content: It started flowing from Narkel Beel of Sunamganj Sadar Upazilla and flows upto Noanagar.

title: Sangil River
content: It started flowing from border of Lalmanirhat of Bangladesh and Kuchbihar of India and then divided into several branches. One fall into Satanga River, another crosses border several times and again join with previous branch.

title: Sungar River
content: It started flowing from Dhaleshwari River of Dhaka and fall into same river.

title: Shaldaha River
content: It started flowing from Madhupur forests of Tangail and fall into Turag River.

title: Singar khal
content: It started from Aloy Beel and Bagula Beel and fall into the Surma river after passing Toker gao, Noyatila , Pathmora beel, rajagao , kurirgao , noahgao , alinogor , eyonakandi and Parkul.

title: Sabedpur River
content: It started from the bolai river at jamalgonj, Sunamgonj and falls into the dholai river after flowing until south shukhey .

title: Soyai River
content: It started from shonjol beel and koya beel at Mymensingh and flowed until kaltapara and bothubdi.

title: Shaitankhali Gang
content: The river started from Janiyarchar Deola in Dharmapasha, Sunamganj and flowed through Rajadharpur, Madhupur, Noyaganj, Radhanagar, Keshobpur-Shonakana until Ajuyarchar.

title: Singra River
content: This river has two origins, one from Kishorganj to Pabda and the other from Dobubil, Sylhet to Goyainghat.

title: Saliyajuri River
content: It is a branch of the Titas river and it started from the north and joined the river after crossing Singer beel.

title: Shalikha River
content: This river generated from Baral river that started between Daho Koladanga and Dotto Pangali of Faridpur Upazilla, Pabna and comes up to Shahzadpur Upazilla Boundary.

title: Sonarabondon River
content: Two streams out from South Bittripara and Raghunathpur (Parbotipur Sadar Upazilla, Dinajpur) that confluence at Raghunathpur and fallen into Korotoya at Hossainpur.

title: Sonkosh River
content: This river ousted between Katajalam and Khoja Kata of Madarganj, Kurigram that divided into two strems at Balarhat which finally fallen into Gongadhor River.

title: Suya River
content: Comes out from Western side of Barshar of Bochaganj Upazilla, Dinajpur that fallen into Tangon river at Srimantapur Ferighat.

title: Sonabari River
content: This river comes out from Velamari of Kurigram Sadar Upazilla that flow up to Baliyamari Ferighat.

title: Shishi River
content: This is the small river of Patgram Upazilla, Lalmonirhat that comes from Indian region.

title: Sheoragari – Koinamoti – Dulkumari River
content: This river comes out from the middle of the Sheoraguri (Dhumpur Bilash and Kanakata of Kuchbihar State) that created boundary between Kuchbihar and Kurigram District and in Bangladesh it meets with Songkosh river at Ratanpur.

title: Syan River
content: This river comes out from the lake of Chota Hazratpur and Rasulpur of mithapukur Upazilla, Rangpur that confluence with Noleya river at Tallakandi.

title: Shwarnamati River
content: This river comes out from Aditmari Upazilla, Lalmonirhat that meets with Tista river.

title: Sharamangola River
content: This river generated from Padma river at Talimari, Rajshahi city that discharged into Faliya Beel near Shirolia.

title: Sondha River
content: This river takes off from Narrow stream of Narad at Puthiya Upazilla, Rajshahi that falls into Kantar Beel.

title: Sota River
content: This river ousted from Katabeel at Mymensingh Sadar and Muktagacha Sadar that flows up to Dapunia.

title: Sakaoya River
content: This river comes out from the lakes of Mekhliganj of Lalmonirhat District that travelling up to Mekhliganj, Vutbar, Araji, Kharibari, Diyabari Kabirajpara, Nilphamari, via Panbari.

title: Sutikidaha River
content: This river derived from Gohala river at Beltoilo Mouja of Ullapara Upazilla, Sirajganj and fallen into Gumnai river at Horiyabari.

title: Subil River
content: Coming from Dashtika Lake of Bogra Sadar Upazilla that patch up with Korotoya river at Shibbati.

title: Sorbamogola River
content: This river ousted from Western side of Belpukur, Syedpur Upazilla, Nilphamari and fallen into Chikli river.

title: Saru River
content: A narrow channel which comes out from Boyalmari Hat at Nilphamari Upazilla and joined with Buri Tista river at North side of Nagor Sahibganj.

title: Sheniajan River
content: This river comes out from Khalar Beel of Khuchbihar State that flowing at bottom part of Panabari after entering bangladesh.

title: Salsala River
content: Takes off from Tirnai river at Tetulia Upazilla and flows as Salsala river up to International Boundary.

title: Subgari River
content: One stream which comes out from South – Western Khorna and Gohail of Bogra Sadar and fallen into Vadai river near Aria and Gohail, is known as Subgari river.

title: Shan River
content: Two streams come out from East and West Edge of Falia Beel, Rangpur that confluence at Jaliya Para is Known as Shan river.

title: Sui River
content: This river comes out from North side of Raguladangi, Meghliganj, India that fallen into Ghoramara river after entering bangladesh.

title: Sud River
content: This river coming out from West Bursha of Bochagaj Upazilla, Dinajpur and meets with Tangon river at Srimantapur

title: Sutarkhali
content: Sutarkhali river starts from Jalpur,Netrokona and one stream ends at the Sylhoty bil, another stream ends at the Nitai river.

title: Sesai
content: Sesai river starts from the Sosabil and ends at the Kalni river.

title: Singadeir
content: Singadeir gang starts from the South-east of Nachaigaon & Sontushpur and ends at the 2-3 km west of starting point.

title: Sadi
content: Sadi river starts from the conjuction of Atgaon-Kamaid-khaiya rivers and ends at the Kapna river.

title: Sonaray(সোনারায় ছড়া)
content: Sonaray chara starts from the border near Tripura hills and ends at the Dhalai river.

title: Sajuri
content: Sajuri river starts from the Maowatiya bil and ends at the Bijna gang.

title: Shashiya
content: Shashiya river starts from Mithapur & Goharuya and ends at Uzargaon.

title: Sundari
content: Sundari river starts from the Border of Chandrapur and ends at the Ghunghur river.

title: Sanchur
content: Sanchur nala starts from Baliakanda & Sanchur and ends at Fatehpur & Nisandokandi.

title: Sukna/Sutki
content: Sukna/Sutki river starts from the Dakni bil and first stream ends at the Boyajur khal, second stream ends at the Ratna river.

title: Suriya
content: Suriya river starts from the Garadoba bil and ends at Bakar kon.

title: Sawrang
content: Sawrang river starts from the Gingini bil and ends at Dhatpur.

title: Sagor
content: Sagor river starts from the Chandigurna bil and ends at Gailora & Dhitpur.

title: Surai
content: Surai river starts from the Amori khal and ends at the Singri khal.

title: Sundrakashi
content: Sundrakashi gang starts from Noyamati and ends at Atkuri bil.

title: Shirka
content: Shirka river starts from Sakhayti and ends at the Nagal bil.

title: Soyair River
content: The route of this river is through Shyamgonj and Gouripur of Netrokona district.

title: Sakra River
content: This river originated from the Kushiyara river in Kamarkhada, Nobigonj situated in Hobiganj district.

title: Singli River
content: This river has a lot of branches that flow through Hobigonj, Sunamganj and Madhabpur.

title: Singer River
content: The river connects with Lain river and flows through Ghoribazar, Amirabad, Chatarkhailota in Hobiganj and ended in Daochapara Haor.

title: Saiduli River
content: This river originated from the border of Modon and Kenduya in Netrokona and fall into Dhalai river after flowing by the border and passing Kenduya.

title: Shirkhali River
content: This river is situated at Jamalpur and it ended in the old Brahmaputra River.

title: Soyai River
content: It is a quite long river that is branched thoroughly in the Mymensingh District starting from Gairpur, Bokhuyadi, Kaltapara, etc.

title: Tongai River
content: Tongai river starts from Nazirpur and ends at Sadhupara.

title: Tungai River
content: Tungai river starts from Pathariya area and ends at the Shwameshwari river.

title: Thana Gang
content: Thana gang starts from Birargaon and one stream ends at the Chatak border, another stream ends at Matjur.

title: Tal River
content: Tal river starts from the Balai haor and ends at the Kushiyara river.

title: Taruba Gang
content: Taruba gang starts from the Mewyabil and ends at Betausha.

title: Thadakura River
content: Thadakura river starts from Bhalka Chapar and ends at the Banar river.

title: Teworkhali River
content: Teworkhali river starts from Haridaspur & Dhanrihara and ends at Kaliyabar.

title: Tista River, Bagerhat District
content: This is the river that joined Silagang & Posura rivers near the Bay of Bengal. This river locates 210 55 / N from the Posura river and fall in Silagang which location is 210 55 / N and 890 84 / E.

title: Tiranai River, Thakurgaon
content: This river originated from the border region of Atwari Upazilla, Panchagarh which is mainly lowland area that joined with Nagor river at Baliadangi Upazilla, Thakurgaon. River lengths is 30 km, width 30 meters and depth is 4 meters. The size of river catchment area is 90 sq. km. Water flow throughout the year and free from tide and ebb.

title: Tiranai River, Panchagarh
content: Border river that generated from Meghalaya State of India that fallen into Tetulia Beel. Length of this river is 7 kilometers. Width is 7 meters. Depth is 3 meters. The area of river catchment is 15 sq. km. River flows all the year but the level of flow rate increases during the rainy seasons (June – July). This time flow rate of water is 16 cubic meters / second. There is no effect of tide and ebb.

title: Turag River
content:
Lohajang river in the upstream of Tangail takes name as Turag in the downstream. This is branch river of Bongshi River.
This river originated from Bongshi of Kaliakoir, and Hilly Bangshi of Bhawal Garh that is under the area of Gazipur District, which flows at Kaliakoir, Zoydebpur, Mirzapur, Gazipur, Savar, Mirpur, and at last fallen into the Buriganga river near Mohammadpur Thana of Dhaka.
River’s length is 71 km, width is 218 meters and depth is 13.5 meters. Catchment area is 1021 sq. km. Flows of water remain all the year. But flow rates vary season to season. During monsoon period, flow rate achieve its highest peak that is responsible for increasing the depth of the river.

title: Tulshi River
content: It takes off from Padma river and fall into the Baral river through south side of Sonabaju Uttar and Polshurapat Para; and Sidhuli and Airmari Beels via Chechuya river. Due to its dyeing condition, now – a – days almost 400 bighas land of Khalishagari Beel are used for Rabi crop production.

title: Tulshiganga River
content:
This river derived from Dhanpara Beel area of Nawabganj Upazilla, Dinajpur, that flows through Birampur, Akkelpur, Panchbibi of Hakimpur, Khetlal and at last join with Atrai river near Sadar Upazilla of Naogaon.
The length of this river is 110 km. Width is 50 meters. Depth is 5 meters. Size of the catchment area is 360 sq. km.

title: Tetongkhal River
content:
Derivate from Hilly region of Habang, Chakoria Upazilla of Cox’s Bazar which fall down near Kutubdia Channel of Bashkhali Upazilla, Chittagong. Pekua Upazilla is situated on the bank of this river.
The length of this river is 14 km. Width is 60 meters. Depth is 3 meters. Size of the catchment area is 50 sq. km.
There is an effect of ebb and tide on it. Local administrative make a cross dam on the river catchment so that stored water that help during the period of irrigation.

title: Tetulia River
content:
It is border river. It forms at Dabor Beel area of Kaharole that enters India through Birol Upazilla of Dinajpur. Local name of this river is Tulai River. As the river frequently changes it’s bent inside of the Bangladesh (Kaharole, Parts of Bochaganj and Birol) that increased the length in many times. This old river is now turned into research topics to anthropologists because of content of various anthropogenic sign.
The length of this river is 56 km. Width is 45 meters. Depth is 5.5 meters. Size of the catchment area is 63 sq. km.
Stream of the river depends on monsoon. On dry season there is no sign of flow. But in the period of rainy season, this flow increased at the rate of 780 cubic meters / second. There is no influence of ebb and tide.

title: Tetulia River
content:
Genesis from north side of the Meghna river of Bhola that streaming through Tetulia, Nimdi, Kalaiya, Purvamunia and discharged into the Bay of Bengal as Buragourango near Ronggopaldi of Golachipa Upazilla. Previously this river was very flashy but lost this characteristics because of sediment deposition on its. This river separated Barisal district from Bhola.
The length of this river is 84 km and average width is 6 km. This river is highly vulnerable for its breakdown nature.

title: Teligati River
content: Originated from Bhodra River of Bhodrodia (Khornia Union of Boundary Zoe between Jessore and Khulna) that flows west side of Shona and again meets with Bhodra. Presently this river almost filled up with sediments.

title: Torsha River
content: This river streaming through Tibet, Bhutan, India and Bangladesh. This river originated from Tang – Pass of Chumbi Valeey (East Tibet). Length of this river is probably 320 km. In the upstream, it’s known as Chumbi. It’s recognized as Amo – Chu in the Chubi and Bhutan. This river called as Torsha in Bangladesh and Zolpaiguri of West Bengal. The meaning of Torsha is angry Streamflow. The nature of this river is really kook types. What happened in the rainy season, anyone have no idea.

title: Thega River
content: This is the one of the main branch river of Karnafuli. It meets with Karafuli at the upstream of Borkol and Sublong and fall into Kaptai Lake.

title: Tusai River
content: It started flowing from Delikuri Beel of Mymensingh district and fall into Mogra River.

title: Tunai River
content: It started flowing from Tetulia of Dharmapasha Upazilla of Sunamganj and fall into Dharail Gang at Garia Khali.

title: Thadokura River
content: It started flowing from Nata Kuri of Muktagacha and Jamalpur Sadar Upazilla and flows upto Doarikhal.

title: Tulsikhali River
content: It started flowing from an old flow of Dhaleshwari and fall into Dhaleshwari River.

title: Turia Done River
content: This river emerges from Golachipa upazila’s Vuria station and runs upto Mosdia.

title: Torki River
content: It tekes off at Kalkini upazila of Madaripur district and at the boundary line of Barisal and Gopalganj district.

title: Tora River
content: It started flowing from Dhaleshwari of Dhaka and fall into Kaliganga River.

title: Updakhali
content: Updakhali river starts from the Shwameshwari river and ends at the Dhanu river. It covers Kalmakanda-Mohanganj,Netrokona district. The total length of the river is 60 km.

title: Umiyam
content: Umiyam river locally known as Shila river. It starts from Doarabazar,Chatak upazila and ends at the Surma river. It covers Chatak upazila,Sunamganj. The total length of the river is 16 km. It’s originated from Jainta hills,India

title: Upti River
content: It started flowing from Charuka Beel of Sylhet and fall into Chapra Beel.

title: Ubra Khal
content: It started flowing from Kushia River of Ajmiriganj Upazilla and flows upto Bhabora.

title: Vaijan Khal
content: It started from Muktagacha in Mymensingh and flows until moheshdara.

title: Vubonchora river
content: It was originated from kashia hill and merged with piyain gang.

title: Vutijhari River
content: This river ousted from Kalandigach of Thakurgaon District as many streams that joined with each other at Western side of Delmara Tea Estate and fallen into Berong river.

title: Vat Khaoa and Zirzira River
content: This river derived from Jinjiram river at Char Mather and Haripur of Kurigram Sadar Upazilla that fallen into Brahmaputra river at Sadhur Para.

title: Veluya River
content: This river outs from Methurpara of Dinajpur Sadar that meets with Jamuneshwari river after travels Hosia and belua beel.

title: Valeshwar River
content: This river comes out from Ichamati river at east side of Nandanpur Hospital (Sathiya Upazilla, Pabna) that divided into Salghar; among them one falls into Muktar Beel and others into Ghughudaho.

title: Varalijan River
content: This river originates from Lohagara river at Koalikandi of Gabtali Upazilla, Bogra that discharged into Ichamati at Trimohani.

title: Velamati River
content: This river ousted between Damair and Joydebpur of Chiribandar (Dinajpur) that falls into Atrai river near Krishnapur.

title: Vimti River
content: Which river flows parallel to the North – East Boundary of Shibganj (Bogra) and Gobindagaj (Gaibandha) Upazilla, known as Vimti river.

title: Vesa River
content: The water of this river flows from East Part of Burir Hat, Panchagarh to Indian Border through Bhojanpur Union.

title: Vulisur River
content: Ousted from Kutgullibeel, after divided into 2 – 3 tributaries again meets at Barakumi that joined with Moraghaghat River at Junipur.

title: Verameni River
content: The river started Rohila Kamalpur in Ajmiriganj and Mymensingh and passed Dhobateka, Ruhiya, Chadpur, Bodorpur, Runiya, Manbari, Nogorbari, Ajmiriganj, Pirispur, Isobpur, Vobanipur, Matiyara, Paharipur, etc on its way.

title: Vola Khal/River
content: It started from the Matamuhuri River and ended in the Kutubdiya Channel after passing Shilkhali, Mehernam, Kacherimura, Guldibaxar, Najirpara, Borobakiya, Vonaighana, Bazarpara, Magnama and Rajkhal
